    From: wls@u.arizona.edu (zentropa)
    To: az-raves@gn5.getnet.com
    Subject: [az-raves] Shite doc
    Date: Sun, 05 Oct

    
    Billboard Magazine, October 4, 1997
    Music Video - Programming
    CLEOPATRA DOCUMENTS THE ELECTRONICA SCENE ON FILM
    By Carrie Bell
    
    LOS ANGELES- in an effort to expose the underground rave scene to a
    mainstream audience,Cleopatra Pictures and Entertainment Group is
    preparing the first full-length documentary onelectronic music,
    featuring appearances by breakout acts like Moby, Aphex Twin, the
    Crystal Method, and Sneaker Pimps.
    
    "This culture has been around for at least a decade, but very few people
    really know the history and what it's all about," says Cleopatra
    president Brian Perera. "We wanted to create a film that took people
    there, showed them the inside, and dispelled any false rumors."
    
    The film, tentatively titled ""Better Living Through Circuitry," started
    shooting in March at the Winter Music Conference in Miami. Since then,
    the crew has filmed in New York, Los Angeles, and San Diego. It also
    hopes to work Detroit and London shoots into the $100,000 budget.
    
    Cleopatra expects to have the first cut by December and a finished
    product by spring 1998, although it has yet to be determined whether the
    project will have a wide theatrical release or go straight to video.
    
    "Several companies have expressed interest in releasing the movie to
    theaters, including Trimark, Nonfiction Films, Miramax, and October,"
    says producer Brian McNelis. "I think people realize this is a good time
    for this film. The music is just starting to change from an underground
    urban legend to something they listen to in Des Moines. It's prior to
    the burnout stage, and the artists are the most interesting and genuine
    at this point." 
    
    Directed by Jonathan Reiss--known for his music video work with Nine
    Inch Nails, Black Crowes, and Type O Negative--the film will include
    performance footage, location shots with opinions from police and fans,
    and interviews with pivotal players like MTV's "Amp" producer Todd
    Mueller and Maverick A&R representative/KCRW Los Angeles DJ Jason
    Bentley. Other artists involved in the project are Electric Skychurch,
    DJ Frankie Bones, Keoki, DJ Spooky, Fluke, and Death In Vegas.
    
    "We tried to incorporate popular, historical, and up-and-coming bands.
    This film is narrated by the people who live this lifestyle. Everything
    you learn from the film will come from the mouth of an insider," McNelis
    says.
    
     The authenticity of the project is what convinced the Crystal Method to
    participate.
    
     "They are trying to avoid the 'Hard Copy' image of the scene's problems
    and expose this energetic and supportive community," says the Crystal
    Method's Scott Kirkland. "We're excited to see the final product and
    hope it sheds light on people's misconceptions. And we're always
    thankful for publicity."
    
     McNelis says one reason Cleopatra, which owns three record labels
    specializing in techno, is involved with the film is that the subject
    matter offers a "visual arena" for the fashion, color, technology, and
    live experience of electronic music.
    
     "It is an eye-candy culture. Just look at all the artists who tour with
    videos or the efforts that goes into designing CD and poster artwork or
    creating the perfect outfit for an all-nighter," McNelis says.
    
     Retailers agree that electronica can only be helped by the film. "Think
    of it as an extended music video. Music films are the next best thing to
    being there, and electronic music is tied so heavily to how the music
    makes you feel," says Bob Reamer, a music buyer for Borders. "This can
    only drive CD sales for the bands involved. Not only do fans of techno
    eat up compilations, but electronica-heavy soundtracks like "The Saint"
    also sold well."
    
     Perera says there will more than likely be a companion album, although
    his record labels probably won't release it. Both Sony and Warner have
    expressed interest.
    
     "Our main concern right now is getting the film done and out there for
    public consumption," Perera says. "We are taking the business part very
    slowly because we want to find partners with the same goals, and do what
    is best for the bands and people involved."
    
    -- 
    
                               
                    ,.;.             Cleopatra Entertainment

Hmmmm . . . .  Well I started the weekend not planning to go out . . .
however i realized that i'm happier in the scene than not. well i
decided to go to trancemasters . . .   however that got broken up.
well shiite like that happens, well then as we search for things to do
we ended up at 8 th and harrison this party kinda scared me. i'm not
sure the name however but there was a sega and a TV in one room. and
the second room had tables however it looked like no one was mixing,
simply a guy with a microphone .  . . hmm i do'nt know what's up wit
dat? but hey everyone has there ways to enjoy there music. Well i
don't know but people weren't enjoying there music. i watched as 40-50
30 to 40 somethings sitting on the floor, as five or so kids were
dancinng hmmm. i don't know about dat shiiite. hmmm . we i decided i
wanted to be with my friends so i along with a few others listened to
micron and chatted. well  my interesting saturday has com n' gone now
on to sunday . . .  hopefully i'll meet denise . . . hopefully i say.

i don't know what kind of scooby snacks i was chomping on when i wrote 
that last post...
somehow i forgot to include Stacey Pullen in my dj list. as the musician 
list should tell you i'm a complete detroitophile, i don't love a lot of 
mr pullen's tracks, but technically he's one of the cleanest mixer i've 
heard (and a few of my favorite detroit artists are less than meticulous 
mixers, i won't say more for fear of incriminating myself) and he mixes 
as an art into itself, totally blending tracks, not just mixing one into 
the other, or just knowing how to build a vibe, he actually creates 
something new and unbeleiveable in the mixes and layers. you have to 
*know* your tracks to do that. He also does something I'm sure Derrick 
taught him and few dj's do well, to hold back and then jack the roof off, 
he will play simpler tracks at lower volumes and then suddenly drop a 
bomb track that seems all the more spectacular because it suprises you 
then build it up and up to the breakdown. waaayy to many dj's think that 
a good set is the maximum number of bomb tracks back to back at steady 
maximum volume. think about it... it's like a rollercoaster that never 
slows down or rolls back up hill leaving you a little time to catch your 
breath let the fear set in for the next drop. i also forgot mike huckaby, 
a second/third? wave detroiter who i have a fond attachment to because he 
played my first rave. i probably have no clue how good or bad that set 
was technically, all i know is it was the most incedible music i had 
heard in my first twenty-six years on earth.... but then first parties 
are like that and we wouldn't have it any other way would we?

devil.
intimacy of that first house of      At some time he will master us all.
flesh. It is always nocturnal        It is not having been in the dark 
for a certain gaze- which wishes     house, but having left it which 
counts.

that it cannot see everything?
- Luce Irigaray

(http://ionx.photon.net),
21-3 Productions' "All Boundaries Are Illusion:  Unique Diversions and
Breaktrance Excursions".  Definitely good stuff.  Here's the track listing:

1.  "Space Sage" - Tristan
2.  "Pol Zirkular" - Factor
3.  "Double Helix" - Digitalis
4.  "Elektro Implant" - Eat Static
5.  "Chaos By Design" - C.B.D.
6.  "First Machine" - Deviant Electronics
7.  "Karmaflage" - ManMadeMan
8.  "Skwirm" - Andy Guthrie
9.  "Slipstream Dub" - Medicine Drum
10.  "Adios Amoeba" - Pan

Shalom,

	Sun, 5 Oct 1997 20:56:39 -0700 (PDT)
Date: Sun, 5 Oct 1997 20:56:39 -0700 (PDT)
From: Noah Apodaca <unclenoa@netcom.com>
Subject: Interesting weekend (downtempo, etc.)
To: "Ravers 'Round the Bay" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Message-ID: <Pine.3.89.9710052014.A6998-0100000@netcom5>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


So I went to Martinez this weekend to visit an old college buddy and spin 
some rekkids at his house before a dazzling slide show and a really fun 
set by DJ Maiz (she's the bomb, kids!). 

Anyway, on Friday night (my friend's party was on Saturday) I went down 
to Kate O'Brien's to hear these other friends of friends who were 
supposed to be spinning for some sort of fashion show thing.  

So the genre at the location was pretty much downtempo groove, if I had 
to give it a name.  A lot of instrumentals from the early-mid sixties 
with plenty of groovy saxophones and organs, etc.  

My friend's friends who were DJing there were really nice.  It was also 
nice to see some more women DJs getting out there.  But at this place 
_none_ of the DJs beatmatched.  Not at all.  Now, I don't find 
beatmatching to be a necessity for being a DJ, or even for being a good 
DJ, but it's odd to go into a bar/club location and find no 
beatmatching.  The other thing that I noticed was that although all the 
tracks I heard were really good, there didn't seem to be much continuity 
in the DJs' sets.  It was like being a a friend's house with them up by 
the CD player going, "Oh yeah!  Here's another good one!", you know what 
I mean?  The other thing that kind of got me was how extensive the DJ rig 
was.  They had 2 1200's in good shape with Ortofon DJ carts, a big Numark 
mixer and a set of Numark pitchable CD players.  All that and no 
beatmatching.  I'm not complaining... it was just different... and a 
little odd. :/

So those of you who listen to downtempo and such, is this style of mixing 
more popular in that scene?  The few downtempo DJs that I have seen at 
raves have all been beatmatchers, so I don't really know.

It was good to hear the tracks though.  A lot of them were ones that I 
used to play on my KDVS show wayyyy back in the day when I was spinning 
groove tunes (before I got on my still un-ended techno kick).

Anyway, I had a fun weekend, and I got a glimpse of a whole different 
scene, I think...

ractice by you and me however small it is feed into the =

science can measure it. =

rkness.  Darkness cannot exist where there is Light present, it must hide=

ad it out far and wide to all so they can see and know for themselves.  W=

munications being recieved by me was much deeper than words could convey,=

when it hits you it changes the person you are but only in a better and h=
igher consciousness.  We can=92t talk about House in words for they are s=
o limited and incomplete to express what it is.  So I write this now to h=
elp re-establish True House again and encourage all you beautiful kids to=
 keep trying and struggling towards this wonder-full goal of House and PL=
UR.  It take people like me and you, wherever we=92re at, doing what we c=
an.  All that is required is that you do your best.  We aren=92t all perf=
ect ,as some think they are, and for many it=92s something new so we all =
fall at first at trying something new but don=92t be discouraged by it. =

=0D
 I say re-establish House because I feel House has started to be forgotte=
n and that=92s the True  reason parties started.  It has turned way mains=
tream, and as it has many numbers have come in and much of the PLUR and H=
OUSE left.  This is sad and we can=92t let it.  We must dream, do, create=
, and believe in the HOUSE or DREAM, for it will manifest strong(er) agai=
n and spread out to the world around us.  Our thoughts and emotions creat=
e just as the kids at my first party thoughts and emotions came into me a=
nd showed me the beauty of HOUSE and BROTHERLY LOVE; they touched my hear=
t in a most positive way, and I=92m thankful for it now.  Please don=92t =
let this great and beauti-full dream fade away into the sunset.  This pla=
net and the people here need it to much for it to be lost.  I feel in a w=
ay the fate of the world depends on it for where else is something like t=
his happening; true there=92s people doing good out there but not on the =
scale we can take it.  We are here now together connected to each other b=
y what is the same inside us all regardless of race, creed, religion or s=
mall differences on a grander scale; that is we are a part of  the same S=
ource.  Our beings within us are One by the One Creator who made us all. =
 This Creator (call Him/Her what you want for He/She is the same Being wi=
th many names) is same One Parent of all of us.  Our Common Creator looks=
 at us all as children and in a loving, forgiving and caring way any idea=
l Parent would look at His/Her Creation.  We are all special and Divine c=
reatures for how could we not be if God is our Creator.  The Creator is t=
he Source of all Life for God is Life, Love, and Light.  The One Father i=
s Mind and Energy and we are the manifestation of it.  As all having a co=
mmon heritage (spiritual and mental) we when at-tune or when at-one-ment =
we share the same Being the same Source.  This is who we truly are beauti=
ful and radiant children of God.  Since we are more than one person here =
when we realize our Divine Kinship we then become a Tribe.  A Tribe know =
how to work and live together in PLUR or it fails and dies.  We can chang=
e it all by becoming ONE SOURCE TRIBE.  We aren=92t connected by outside =
physical structure but by the internal One structure.  We understand the =
truth of who and what we are and live according to our hearts and our hig=
hest consciousness  which is all tapped into the same Source.  We underst=
and that mankind is the child of the One Divine Mind, and we live in harm=
ony with this knowledge and kinship we all share as children.  The unifyi=
ng force of this all is PLUR.  We also know and respect the Law of Give a=
nd Receive/Law of Cause and Effect/Karma.  Even if we were selfish and di=
dn=92t want to do this it would be in our best interest for what you do u=
nto others is done unto you.  Let us realize our kinship in the Source an=
d begin to live as Tribes of  Old did, and all work for the betterment of=
 the One SourceTribe to its highest and best good.  Start NOW(is theonly =
real time that Truly exists.) =

**********One last note I would like to give props and thanks to all the =
kids who ahve been following this dream.  You are all so beauti-full and =
 wonder-full have affected my life deeply.  I especially want to give tha=
nks to all the fore-fathers of this scene (DREAM) and to all the people w=
ho have kept it going.  Many of you have sacrificed much to do what you h=

ife might be better for other=92s out there.  Also many thousands of mad =

nd you.  A Final shout out to all who are starting to see the DREAM and w=
ant to live it; know now that the Future is in your and our hands.*******=

andon                                             =

nd Love in our hearts.                 =

LIFE, LIGHT, LOVE & PLUR
=0D
SOLUTION TO THE STATE OF THE WORLD
=0D
There=92s so many problems around us today.  It=92s frustrating and depre=
ssing to say the least.  To try to overtake or fix the many problems wher=
e can and do you start at.  In reality we can=92t take on all these immen=
se problems we see around us, for they are to large, and our lives requir=
e to much for us to give the focus to the time and attention needed.   =

=0D
There is a possible solution to the problems of the world and a way to a =
happier existence.  It=92s not a new message but a new delivery of it.  T=
he solution starts with You and then goes to Us. We cannot change everyth=
ing around us for it simply won=92t, but we can change ourselves.  We can=
 grow and become the best people we can be which in turn has an affect on=
 all things around us.  People are affected by those around them whether =
it=92s positive or negative and nowadays it=92s mostly negative.  Most pe=
ople live in so much fear of everything around them.  Fear only paralyzes=
 us and makes things worse (remember the saying frozen with fear).  That=92=
s what=92s happening.  We are focusing to much on the bad things and the =
problems which only magnifies them.  What we need to do is start to focus=
 on positive changes and solutions; how this  starts is with each individ=
ual person.  =

=0D
We must do our best to have a positive attitude and start practicing Peac=
e, Love, Unity and Respect.  PLUR.  As we do this it starts to be created=
 and as it is created it then becomes reality.  How things become created=
 is with our thoughts and emotions.  They provide the blueprint for the r=
eality we live and see.  This is happening  whether people are aware of i=
t or not just as many things are happening everyday without people=92s aw=
areness of it.  Your thoughts and emotions become your experiences (fears=
/negative as well as faith/positives).  We are responsible for our own fa=
te in that what we think, the attitudes and prejudices we hold, and how w=
e treat ourselves and other=92s.  These are infinitely reflected back to =
us.  =

=0D
Most don=92t realize this but as you show them the see it because they ar=
e thousands of examples and demonstrations in our lives on how this is do=
ne (a sick man=92s thoughts are on his sickness, while a poor man=92s tho=
ughts are on what he doesn=92t have) all manifested as they are feed into=
 the creating energy of the universe.  Just look at your own life and try=
 to see it such as something you always wanted and strive so hard to get =
did you not receive it, and if not, most times later you find out it was =
better that you probably didn=92t get it.  To take it to the next step ou=
r thoughts as a whole (every person) then collectively creates our societ=
y we live in.  Each person contributes to society and nation as each indi=
vidual life of each cell of the body contributes to the whole of  who you=
 are.  If there is a problem we see around us individually or as a societ=
y we must look to ourselves as the cause of it.  Many don=92t like to thi=
nk this way because they want to point fingers at others and say no it=92=
s them over there.  Well it=92s time to wake up for we all are doing it t=
ogether.  Maybe we didn=92t even create it but we are accepting it and no=
t doing anything about it.  If we are doing this then we are allowing it =
to stand and supporting that which we don=92t like around us.  The proble=
m is we have been focusing to much outwards to fix the problems but the r=
eal answers lies inward (with-in us).  =

=0D
What=92s this answer you say?  It=92s so simple and yet so complex.  We c=
an become better people and strive to live PLUR in our everyday lives, an=
d then we can make changes around us by own living and being.  We extend =
and spread out our vibe to those around and if it=92s positive then it=92=
s returned to us and if it=92s negative it=92s also returned to us.  It w=
as once said long ago =93Do unto others as you would have them do unto yo=
u=94  If we all truly practiced this in our everyday lives, IMAGINE where=
 our society and the race of man would be right now.  We would be much fu=
rther evolved in spirit and mind and we wouldn=92t have most of the probl=
ems we are all facing as we look out around us now and see our future ahe=
ad of us.  =

=0D
We are constantly creating our life around us with our thoughts and emoti=
ons are feeding into some unseen energy ,which then responds to and produ=
ces visible results which we see and live as reality, individually and co=
llectively.  The law of cause and effect is operating on the spiritual an=
d mental levels as well as the physical level.  The causes on these level=
s in our thoughts and emotion with life and reality the effects.  We usua=
lly don=92t relate the in-world with the out-world but they are very conn=
ected indeed.   We as a race of man just haven=92t truly understood that =
we are all interconnected with each other as our own cells in our body as=
 interconnected with each other.  Our quality of live truly does depend o=
n the quality of life of those around us and their happiness.  No man is =
an island, let us remember our interdependence and start to live in TRUTH=
=2E  We are One people, One nation, One spiritual race.  The physical is =
the least who we truly are but really the most apparent.  Since it=92s th=
e most apparent it hard to look past, but we must or else it=92s going to=
 get worse for us all.
=0D
As we live and practice love, light, and life(living) these positive ener=
gies are then returned into our lives.  This is the HOUSE and happiness w=
e all feel at a party (hopefully many of you tonight are experiencing it =
as you read this and will continue to as the night goes on).  We come to =
celebrate life, people, and love amongst each other, and we create a high=
er unity; a higher way of living and being.  We are all responsible for t=
he good time we all have because we all  add to it and create it together=
=2E  The more you give to it the better you feel.  There is a scary part =
though is it=92s not normal for this world to know what we know.  =

=0D
The world we are in practices separation and fear while we are practicing=
 love and unity.  They are now persecuting us for partying and sharing th=
e great time together we are sharing.  This is not the truth of the matte=
r.  We are light, love, and life.  We are practicing and living a better =
way of life.  We seek Truth and are living and having fun.  This is not w=
rong, but what life is really about.  What=92s the point of living if you=
 are not happy and feeling good.  This makes life exciting and makes the =
hard work of life enjoyable.  It=92s  necessary that we have fun for it i=
s healthy for us and in addition creates a better world it does this beca=
use when we are healthy and happy we do better at living, work, relations=
hips, and practice PLUR  the best.    They are trying to portray to the m=
asses something else.  They fear who we are and what we are doing.  They =
use the media tool to convince many younger people parent=92s and the gen=
eral public (who don=92t know what it is all about) as we are evil crazy =
drug users.  They use the worst case scenario=92s at what can happen at a=

 =

=0D
Everywhere you look bad things are happening.  The worst killer right now=
 is alcohol, but it=92s still freely celebrating on every corner in Ameri=
ca.  We all know more people are dying from drunk driving than any other =
thing but are they covering this, No, they are covering what they don=92t=
 like and picking us out.  We are a culture(ravers) who generally speakin=
g ,are not into drinking, getting all fucked up, being depressed and hurt=
ing other ourselves or those around us.  We are about positivity and love=
=2E   They are not promoting these ideals in our culture.  All they do is=

 as we grow up through television and movies and you learn at a young age=
 how adult=92s deal with other adults; the old fashioned way go duke it o=
ut or go to war and kill each other.  We are doing so much good for ourse=
lves and other=92s in partying, for where we are is the celebration of th=
e true individual, life, light, and love.  It=92s truly about PLUR.  Reme=
mber this as you party and stick up for who and what we are for it is rig=
ht and good.  Those that are here who are not about these things I hope y=
ou will eventually see the beauty of this and want to embrace it and cont=
ribute your part to it and see and know that is a better living than the =
old way.  This is the Future for mankind and we are the start of it.  It=92=
s much more fun and beautiful to live on this planet when those around us=
 are practicing these ideals.   It makes life alot more enjoyable and act=
ually very exciting.  How many people out there in the old world are feel=
ing this.  Very few!
=0D
Know one thing, that you are right in what you are doing.  Be extremely p=
roud of who you are and what you are doing for it=92s good and righteous(=
right-use).  You are not problem but the answer and solution to the probl=
em.  If you practice a better way of thinking and living you are on the r=
ight track and the reward is so wonder-full not only for you and other=92=
s but for the world as a whole.  You are and will live a full and complet=
e life while those who don=92t do what you and we are doing are leading  =
an empty and illusionary life.  They have no great fulfillment in Life wh=
ile everyday of our lives can be and is fulfilling as we choose it to be.=
  I have great respect and admiration for any and all who are trying to d=
o better in living and treating others.   This is not only good for those=
 around you, but it=92s the best for you.  If you haven=92t tried this wa=
y yet release your fear, stick your feet in the water(you=92ll find it=92=
s warm) and try practicing PLUR.  It=92s such a better way of living and =
it=92s so much a happier and  joyous experience of life to partake of.  =

=0D
We are all mostly here for one common reason and this is HOUSE.  We are h=
ere to have a good time, so make sure and have it, but also don=92t forge=
t about your neighbor next to you, their happiness is also interdependent=
 on yours, for it creates a higher happiness HOUSE for you to.  Let us re=
alize this Truth and contribute to other=92s happiness and help make it f=
or them; as we do, we truly make our own, for ALL IS INFINITE REFLECTION =
AND INFINITE REFLECTION IS ALL.  Our better life lies in our positive tho=
ughts and emotions and also in helping other=92s to have a better and mor=
e fulfilling life.  We all magnify and multiply each other as we do this.=
  PLUR.  When we come together as people in HOUSE  and in the spirit of u=
nity it=92s not just one person and one person =3D two person, but really=
 one person squared =3D  1 or two person=92s squared =3D 4 or three perso=
ns cubed =3D 27 and so on.  =

=0D
This magnified number value is an example of the higher HOUSE AND UNITY w=
e create together collectively.  The more people in it the more magnified=

e all feel the rush of it and benefit from it but remember one thing it s=

bout but many by their own choosing miss out.  They and You don=92t have =
to though it is for all people and it=92s thrilling to share and experien=

the PLUR together and share in this wonderful energy freely. =

=0D
We can change the world this way in simply doing and continuing on with w=
hat we are already doing.  We are the future.  While the out-world speaks=

We are manifesting action of the right way of living and being.  Be proud=

Hey guys.

I had a GRRREAT time at this party. It all started by meeting a bunch of
you in Fremont and then cruising over to Toofy's and planning on going to
Trancemasters. Unfortunately it got cancelled/busted. Therefore we went to
Fantasy Island instead. Lets just say that I've been DIEING to listen to
some GOOD house. What could be better for this then NYC's Frankie Bones??
I've never heard him spin (Captain Crunch.... sigh) and was looking
forward to it. So we all went down there and partied.... it was a blast. I
met so many cool people... and ran into someone I met at another party....
someone who I grooved with during the last hour or so... to the
beautiful house music... it was NICE. :) I will definately
see her again. soon... Unfortunately I missed Jeno's set... for some
reason I thought he was going to be in the main room?? Too bad for me.. I
walked into the saide room 5 minutes after he finished his set.... aaah...

Hugs to all the new SFravers I met....  especial huggles to Toofy... for
picking me up and taken me out.. when I thought I was going to have a
Blockbuster night. Thanks so much. Friends are the best.

Then we went to the after party... at DeepFogs... it was a nice way to
adapt to the world again after partying all night.....   but would have
been even nicer... would have been to crawl into an oxygen take and sleep
for the next 12-18 hours... :) I could use that right now in fact. Anyone
got one I can borrow.. ha-ha..

Well.. it was a nice weekend.... see you guys soon.


 Byroni the Space Cowboy
 "Won't you join me on a cosmic interlude...?"

Hey all = )

okay before i start this one out I just want to let you know that this isn't a
its more of a general observation and maybe it might generate a response.

Let me also clear up a few things tp preempt a couple of arguments
No I don't have a homepage and I could'nt do it better b/c 
1. general boycott of homepages that suck (and mine would suck)
2. I can think of 100 different other things i would rather do than code HTML
   and reloading my page with different resolutions and browsers to make sure 
   it looks okay.
3. My html coding skillz are way below average so please refer back to #1

now with that out of the way lets move on shall we ? = )

Has anyone else noticed that all there party crews and organizations (for lack 
of a better term) have home/web pages but they haven't been updated in months
and in some cases years. The worst being in a state of permanent construction.

Some are cool anyways cuz you get pics and bios about the crew and what they
represent but others just are promoting some party from 96 without any
real information. 

This again really doesn't bother me cuz I know how much I hate to write html
and I know others must share my frustration, (here comes the big BUTT = ) )
But, I am constantly seeing flyers with url's for there homepages and they
are static, having the same stuff ....

So is this really a gripe? No not really like i said more of a general
observation maybe with a little hope that someone will see/read this 
and maybe take a little initiative and update their page(s).  You know like a 
once a month update or something.

A lot of times i have got nuthin better to do that to waste away buring my
retinas with netscape, and a new fresh page about an upcoming party
or pics / reviews of their last party would be nice.

well I think i have work to do...

hugz,

herb

Hey All,

I've been kinda hesitant to do this (it's nice having an uncrowded store to 
shop in) but my concience has gotten the better of me...

Aaron Shen (formerly did all the import ordering for BPM) has opened his 
own store.  It's called "Clear" and its on Valencia, just off of Division. 
 Make a right on Valencia as you're coming up the hill towards Market 
street.  It's on your right about 1/2 block down.

The place is really nice -- lots of space, lots of _good no-nonsense 
house_, and Aaron is probably the most accomodating store owner you can 
find.

Anyhow, he hasn't done a whole lot of promotion of the store, and I just 
want to see that it stays around for everyone to take advantage of.  So 
check it out.  His phone number is (415) 437-1578 if you wanna give the 
store a call.

BTW, I have no affiliation with Clear -- just figured that getting the word 
out would only help everyone in the long run.

-- Oliver

     Hi all,

     in November a mayday in Innsbruck (austria).

there's incredible potential for a stateside web agency like Obsolete 
(www.obsolete.com) to come along and create a steady income based solely 
around developing and maintining sites for promoters, clubs, djs, record 
labels, artists, etc. Now's the time to do it since the popularity of 
both internet and rave culture have never been higher, or more 
mainstreamed.
Needless to say that techno style and that techno aesthetic are pretty 
popular right now, so you can make money *and* still win design awards 
for your sites. =)

I've been thinking of how to create a web agency with a niche in the rave 
market for over a couple years now and am about ready to go off and do it 
just because noone else has yet, other than Obsolete -- but they're in 
the UK....If done correctly it can be fun and profitable to produce small 
sites like the ones promoters/clubs need, and then set up maintenance 
contracts to udate the site monthly and then redesign every few months. 

If there's anyone out there like Vitamin B from soda.berkeley.edu who's 
got web agency experience and would like to actually embark on such a 
venture, by all means send me mail!

(But I live back in Colorado now, not in SF any longer, by the way)

BTW, be sure and check out Obsolete if you haven't yet...Best thing this 
side (other side, actually) of Hyperreal...




                                             andyhawks@usa.net

>To all you not quite as fly kids that haven't posted your favorite DJ's yet,

>there is still time for you to be as cool as everyone else.... POST NOW!!!

***

well princess, in an attempt to avoid stinking... I think I will have to lay down a bit of info on myself instead, which I havent' done yet [and seems to be the accepted thing to do].  


I *have*  posted a few times, and had a pretty good thread with Leslie on the whole love issue...  I try to keep my opinions/advice to myself, unless queried.  

My opening statement: I guess I am more or less a remote form of raver.


I have a deep passion for dancing, and cannot put/find enough of the music into my tremblin' earballs...  I don't get a chance to go to as many parties as I would like...  the amount of work I do(14/6), and lack of decent pay [kind of a favor I'm working on 2 yrs now for my best friend known 23yrs] at our Sacramento ISP keep me rather tied up (which *can* be good, but not at work).


The parties I have been to are primarily in Sac.  I usually just lose myself in the vibe and dance til' it's over, or i just cant go on.  Dj Dan has killed me, besides being the only dj I can really remember having actually heard and remembered.  The names aren't as important to me... it's the  vibe of the partiers, and if the Dj can keep  me up dancing.. they rule.  It's not me out there, it's them.. and I give  props to all for being my source.  


I have been killing myself for many years (brn liqr alcoholic) and dancing has been my way of kicking that shite for a while now.  My addiction has luckily kept me from becoming hooked on any other of the plethora of crap I've put in me.  I am a thinker, a story teller (long-winded), and an artist/writer (recreational).  I love the outdoors, hockey, my dog, and my friends.  Ex-Navy medical, Ex-marriage, Ex-trodinarily nice.


Met some *wonderful* peeps @ Burning Man this year [great mixes out there this year!] including Steve-O, Ahnon, and Rob.. [sf based] who encouraged me to get on sfraves.  Steve-O spins, but can't remember if I caught his turning there. I do remember a good friend of mine [sfraves list memb./davis based] RJ Briggs's set...  


Story: We had been waiting for him to show up from Santa Cruz and meet us... I walked over to the Faux-Est and no one was dancing... the mix was kickin' so I got right out in the middle of it, and started doing my thing... "Sol!" I hear...  I looked up into the tower... and there was RJ.. had just pulled in...and climbed up for a set.  "RJ!" I yelled back giving him air huggers... "I'll go get the crew!" I ran back and collected my troupe and they all jumped up and hustled over to the site.  RJ had a great set, mixin' in some jazz/horns [something familiar, cant remember] with our crew out there dancing, getting RJ revved up... soon there was hardly any open spots to dance.  Love that guy. 


Could go on forever, but gettin' kind of long here... other music: celtic, jazz, blues, ska, regge, oldies... well, actually I listen and enjoy all types of music... except most rap and country [I just cant dance to it].


Working on a flyer... http://www.deepwell.com/~balanced comments appreciated [my first].


Thanks for letting me vent...PLUR, elbow grease for peace... huggers n' shooga to all.




--------------------------------------------------------------------------

**stay balanced, co-exist, and share peace.**

_____________________________________

--------------------------------------------------- SOL --------------

to be honest after rereading that post i was a little embarrased - it
didn't seem as clever as i thought it was when i posted.  what can i
say, i was sort of "feeling the spirit" when i wrote it.  however, i'd
like to take this opportunity to calmly restate the main points of
that post, which were, basically:

1. don't let it's legality and ease of purchase fool you: ephedrine is
speed.  

2. if you don't take it all the time, it works pretty well, at least
well enough to keep you up till the end of the party.  if i haven't
taken it in a while, it actually gets me pretty pumped up.

3. it may not be good for you, but it is definately much much better
for you than crystal meth.  

but of course it doesn't have that "i'm cool because i do hard drugs"
mystique like crank does.

- messiah wannabe


ps.  i say some "just say know" fliers for the first time this
weekend.  i thought the graphic design work was really cool (also the
info seemed pretty useful, although i thought the techno-babble might
be kind of hard to wade through if you were high on drugs...)

> used in
> the manufacture of (meth)amphetamines, it is not the same thing.

Ok, it ain't speed, but it does cause the same effect in the brain, from
what I can tell, that of increasing nor-adrenaline or nor-epinephrine.

I tried Khat, and before chewing was greatly sceptical, looked like a
*very* silly way to take drugs to me. But wow! It really did the trick.

>From the info in the drugs archive, the key thing here is cathinone, and
whether it be cathinone or amphetamine, or meth-cathonone from
pseudo-ephedrine, how it *feels* is the same. 

>From what the person says here, the fact he was off-on-one meant,
surely, the effects 'do the job'.

I also think that 2cb and acid and mushrooms all same the feel to me,
but that would do doubt cause a *mass* of threadage.

Yours Nick
ps. hi to all on sfrave, this is my first mailing/posting!

Message-ID: <971006211457_1732516203@emout11.mail.aol.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: if you ever take E read this! (not a warning)
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


Hi all!

don't know if anyone's ever posted anything about this, so excuz if so:

have read that one of the things E does is deplete seratonin levels in the
brain. this is what gives some that washed-out, kind of depressed feeling
after a night of partying. long-term, depleted levels of seratonin have been
shown to lead to bad stuff (severe depression, sleep disorders, etc.).

 I decided to do a little medical experiment on myself based on the above
(and a friend joined me, purely of her own free will I might add). I went to
a health food store and asked if their was any food suppliment that could
counteract seratonin loss. Guy immediatly told me about tryptophan (full name
5-hydroxy l-tryptophan or 5-htp) an amino acid that occurs naturally in some
foods (it's the stuff in turkey that makes you sleepy). 5-htp is the
immediate precursor to seratonin production. 

So anyway we took a couple of these babies on Sunday as we were coming down
after a complete night of dancing (weee!) and indulging. The difference for
both of us was really wild. felt much more alert and happy than usual, almost
complete lack of the normal edginess, and just generally more at peace with
the world. When i ended up getting to bed around 2:00 i almost instantly fell
blissfully asleep. my friend kelly also had the same reaction. 

i know this is completely unscientific and the placebo effect could always be
a factor. but I also know my body pretty well and it had never felt this good
after a serious night like this one. 

let me know if anyone else has tried it.

PLUR++,

brian

p.s. i have nothing to do with any entity that could profit from this stuff.
purely a public service.

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"

Precedence: bulk

At 04:01 PM 10/6/97 -0700, andyhawks wrote:
>there's incredible potential for a stateside web agency like Obsolete 
>(www.obsolete.com) to come along and create a steady income based solely 
>around developing and maintining sites for promoters, clubs, djs, record 
>labels, artists, etc. Now's the time to do it since the popularity of 
>both internet and rave culture have never been higher, or more 
>mainstreamed.

It sounds great until you realize there's really not enough money there to
sustain a business on it.  Obsolete doesn't make any money from the record
label sites they do; it's a showcase for their
look-we-can-ape-designers-republic -better-than-anyone design talents, as a
lead-in to more profitable work for companies like Levi's.  

It's much more cost effective for these groups to follow the DIY model and
build their own sites and develop in-house web skills; e.g. WarpMart.  I
think it's a safe bet that if a rave promoter isn't updating his web site
once every couple of months, they're probably not going to pay to have
someone else do it.  Spoken from bitter experience. :)

	Brian

Eric Pederson wrote:
> 
> Nick Macro writes...
> > From the info in the drugs archive, the key thing here is cathinone, and
> > whether it be cathinone or amphetamine, or meth-cathonone from
> > pseudo-ephedrine, how it *feels* is the same.

> While there are some similarities between the effect of ephedrine and meth,
> you could say coffee *feels* the same too.  But coffee and ephedrine
> make you very jittery while meth does not.  Also you do not get "high"
> from coffee or ephedrine.

I'm in the UK, but we've had some speed that's been coloured (I kid you
not) Pink! It really had a much more different effect than the white
base speed I get now, far 'warmer'. My guess was that it was meth, and
the colouring was to differentiate it from other speed. Other people
spoke highly of it as well. It's also called 'Pink shampagne'. Later, I
got hold of small bright red round tablets, which I guessed was the
speed without filler. This was really nice.

I'd like to try, and make some meth-cathinone from pseudo-ephedrine from
sudafed, though.

Yours Nick
ps. If this is off-topic I'll shut up. If you're worried about security,
we could go to rot13.

argh, why did i start this silly-named thread going again?  oh well.

> under this definition, coffee is speed.

well, can you think of any reason (besides the maxwell house
lobbyists) why coffee isn't considered speed?  certainly the effects
are pretty much the same.  i consider coffee a drug, same as alcohol,
marijuana, mushrooms, or any other organic mind altering substance.

>   ephedrine is about as useful
> as coffee for speeding you up.  once you take more than a certain
> amount you get way jittery and it is very unpleasant. 
> 

well, actually i think ephedrine is quite a bit stronger than coffee.

but mostly i guess this is the point i miserably failed to get across
on my original post:  

i probably went through the same usage patterns with ephidrine as most
people when a friend turned me on to it so many years ago.  first i
took one or two to study or maybe just for kicks, i can't remember
which.  then i started taking it frequently.  then it stopped working
so well.  then i tried taking a handfull of them (well like 12 anyway)
and it sucked.  then i stopped taking them for years.  "kid stuff"  i
thought "don't like it a bit".  then, years later, i rediscovered it. 
and after spending years of effort finding some sort of balance and
sustainability as a dedicated drug enthusiast, i tried using the stuff
like i would any other drug - avoiding continual use so as not to
build up tolerance, for instance.  suddenly, i had a new drug in my
pallete of indulgences, one that had similar effects as meth,
admitedly a good bit weaker (but i don't consider that a fault) and
without the unpleasant side effects, which i dislike intensely.  it
filled a need for me, because i like to dance all night as often as
possible, but don't like to take hallucinogens every weekend - i think
its bad for your brain to take that sort of substance too often,
especially when you've been doing drugs as long as i have.  i know
people tend to write minithins off because they're legal and easily
obtained and therefore contain absolutely no "street cred" but i for
one find the stuff quite useful for those very reasons.

jesus, how did i wind up talking about friggin' minithins again?  does
anyone know where i can score some 2CB?

- messiah wannabe

If I could waste everyones time really quick...I'd like to make some comments
on the whole situation.  I think that there was a lot of facts left out when
the story was told the first time and I just wanted to clear some stuff up.
 Greg (Kid Bippy) is a resident Sac DJ.  We all love him and we love to have
some talent in our boring little city! :)  He agreed to spin at *Play Nice*
as a favor to Jenny and Nichole and because of the fact that it was for a
children's chairity.  He had plans to spin at Life Force the night before and
he turned down a paying job to drive 4 hours to Monterey.  He unfortunatly
was not able to get any sleep the night before because he had a late spot at
Life Force and he had stuff to do the next day.  He drove up to Monterey to
spin and he was nothing less than pooped :-)!  He was told that he was
spinning @ 1 but when the sound showed up late, he was told that he would be
spinning a lot later than intended.  He understood this and was very cool
about it.  It was his manajor that would not accept it.  He handled himself
very poorly but he was drunk and a little upset.  Something that I wanted
everyone to understand is that the fight was never about "peek hours" it was
about Greg having to drive 4 hours home after getting no sleep the night
before.  He was tired and worn out and yet he still took it all like a
trooper!  (that is more than I could say for me because I am a Grinch when
I'm tired :) hehehe!!!)  Greg didn't care when he went on, he offered to stay
later.  Once he went on, he was teased and mocked by some of the other DJ's.
 (way un-cool if you ask me :-P)  He was made fun of for playing an
old-school set... I LOVE OLD SCHOOL!!
Oh well, we are all going to have our opinions on the whole ordeal but I just
wanted those of you that didn't know all the facts to be a little more
informed :)  I didn't want anyone to have to miss out on a great DJ because
of a misunderstanding.  

   Sorry for bringing up old business!  It was just something that I had to
get off my chest.  To anyone that now hates Mikey (Kid Bippy's manager); he
really isn't that bad...you just have to get to know him!  He was attempting
to stick up for a friend and I do respect that!  

     If anyone is still unclear about any of the happenings at *Play Nice*
feel free to post and ask me or you can e-mail me privately.  You could ask
Nichole too I'm sure, she actually knows everything first hand!  Thanks for
reading this, I know it was long!

                                       XOXOXOXOXOXOXOXOXOX
                                         Hugs and Sloppy Kisses-
                                       ~*~ the Glitter Princess ~*~

P.S.  Thanks to Byroni for asking.  I really wanted to say all of that but so
much time had past and I thought that everyone had forgotten, obviously they
haven't :)

Thanks to Jer for sticking up for Bippy, he isn't signed up and he can't
stick up for himself!

Thanks to Nichole for being such a great friend and for having such a great
passion for the truth!  I love you!  To put it in your words; you are
"fresh-ass"!!

In a message dated 10/7/97 1:54:33 AM, you wrote:

<<I went to
a health food store and asked if their was any food suppliment that could
counteract seratonin loss. Guy immediatly told me about tryptophan (full name
5-hydroxy l-tryptophan or 5-htp) an amino acid that occurs naturally in some
foods (it's the stuff in turkey that makes you sleepy). 5-htp is the
immediate precursor to seratonin production. >>

claim, is that tryptophan has been banned by the FDA from sale in the US.

was it really tryptophan that you were taking, or just some hokey bunk stuff
that this guy was trying to sell you just to make a buck.??

Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

L-Tryptophan is the precursor to 5-htp.  So when you take 5-htp, it is
actually a step closer to seratonin than tryptophan.  5-htp is a natural
substance (one brand is made from seeds) for purposes of FDA regulation.
Typtophan was banned due to some contaminates in a synthetic batch, but
5-htp is a different substance.  5-htp is superior to tryptophan in some
ways.  You generally have to take much less 5-htp for the same effect as a
larger amount of tryptophan.   It does have a few drawbacks such as
"gastrointestinal distress."

I saw a reference to a study that showed that taking tryptophan
before E potentiated the effect.  Anyone try this with 5-htp?

Seeing how I kinda feel responsible for this thread I would like to make one 
last comment.

Granted his manager was drunk but that does not excuse some of his behavior that
night.  Second he (k.b. for short) might be a nice guy but while his manager 
was reaming everyone he just stood there quietly not saying a thing.  He 
could have tried to talk to him or settle him down or say "hey its okay"
but he did not as well.  I don't think a lot of people made very clear 
choices that night so its okay.

Second issue i want to discuss is old school.  Who ever got that idea that
anyone here doesn't like old school is wrong.  Its just that I heard it
every weekend for 2 years and so did a lot of people. I know that some of
the music is new to you and thats great. I am happy that you are finally getting
to hear some bomb ass tunes.   But there are a lot of us who don't want to
hear an entire set of nothing but old school.  This was my complaint. Also
driving all day/night does tend to make you cranky and irritable, just 
ask a group pf kids(DJ's) who drove to oregon after one party only to spin at
another.

Another thing that it is great for you to support you local scene and its
DJ's and I commend you on that as well.  But before you truly decide that
Kid Bippy is your man ask yourself this question.

Why do I like kid bippy so much?

Is it b/c he is a nice guy and local?
This i will grant you because I don't know him personally. And its always nice 
to have a local dj that you can claim as your own.

Is it b/c of the music he spins?
He is spinning music 4-5 years old.  If it is the music then what about all the
DJ's now who and progressed onto other music.  4-5 years ago they were
spinning this stuff but you do not consider them as some of your more favorite
dj's.

Is it b/c he has talent?
I watched him spin and he has some basic mixing skills.  I can see him improving
a lot with lots of practice.  I think that spinning music thats not old school
would help out a lot with his mixing skills.

Is it b/c he has been around.
This i couldn't tell you for sure.  The first time I saw his name was the
2nd planet rock for which I didn't go to b/c I was at 4x4.  That was jsut two
months ago so to me is his fresh in the scene.  Is this necessarily bad no.

If After asking yourselves this question and honestly answer it, you can say
that K.B. is your favorite DJ, then who am I to say any different. Support him
as much as you can.  

But I 
recommend going to a party and really listen to some of the other DJ's out
there before deciding.  You would be amazed at all the talent out there.

As for the K.B. is the next DJ Dan. its obviously you have never really 
heard DJ Dan spin and its possible you haven't heard either one.


humbly,

herb

sorry if I seem a tad upset over the whole thing.... but I do know who
Mikey is.... I may not know him too well, but I don't want to. I don't
believe in what he's all about and what he does. It's kinda upsetting to
find someone calling Planet Crock a rave. If you want to discuss "what
raving is all about" let do it! Planet Rock is in no way a rave at all..
it definately is not what raving is all about.... Far too many people
are losing touch with what this whole rave thing is about. It's about
the sense of community and togetherness, it's about the family, the
love, how we help each other out, and the energy we can create together.
It's about the music, the people. PLUR isn't a joke like a lot of people
treat it, it was a goal. Now with all these HUGE parties, some about
raving, some not, too many people who don't care about the scene and
what it's supposed to be about, have come along and are screwing things
up! No one is teaching them or telling them what this rave scene, is
for, or what it's about. They make up their own reasons to go to raves,
wether it be for the right reasons or wrong. Too much drug _abuse_, too
much violence, too many people who just don't care. It all is ruining
what was supposed to be one of the best things we could share!

wishing for too much, jer =)

ps. maybe someday...

oh yeah... just to clear a few things up.... I'm not perfect either, no
one is, but we all sure as hell can try to be!

PHAT BINARY
digital design for the analogue underground 
650-917-1217 . shimmer@concentric.net
. web sites . streaming audio . fliers . j-cards . packaging .

I have just done a low profile launch of such an agency. I was starting 
this up on the East Coast, but just relocated and took some time out for 
a couple personal projets and to get situated on the left coast. On a 
freelance basis I did a high bandwidth site for Satellite Records with a 
shockwave interface. The demo is up at www.mediatekk.com/pure/satellite. 
I am also doing a site for Eddie Flashin' Fowlkes City Boy records. I 
have also done numerous j-cards and fliers for the east coast 
underground. Samples are up at www.mediatekk.com/pure and more at 
www.mediatekk.com/pure/rave. I can handle 4-c printing, album and 
cassette covers and inlays, as well as web hosting with audio, video, and 
commerce security. I am working on launching a web site soley for pb, and 
will announce when it goes up. Any promoters, dj's, labels interested in 
contacting me, have at it.

seamus

	A point - tryptophan was made illegal NOT because of the
substance itslef, but because it's production methods are tricky and a
few years ago there were far too many cases of people taking it to
help get to sleep or whatever getting sick and dying because of
contamination at the manufacturer even though it was purchased at
regular drug stores. I don't remember exactly what happened to you,
but do remember the issue being raised.

On Sat, 04 Oct 1997 17:36:58 EDT foolish_fish1@juno.com writes:
>
> JD4150171@aol.com writes:
>) Why is SF the bastion of slow, groovy, funky, 
>>deep,soulful house? Aren't we over it yet? Why do people think slower 
>= 
>>mature?


#1    because this is the style of  music from the  disco glory years 
when alot of people first found the rave (91-92-93)   these people are
mature now

#2   because more places that are 21+ play this kind of music.   when is
the last time you saw or heard of a 21+ night of all breakbeat and
trance?  parties that play predominantly breakbeat and techno often have
a younger crowd.

#3   most people who are older and still going out are not on speed that
much so a slower deeeper groove feels right

#4  soul and funk isn't something that you "get over" anyway. (if you
truly feel it in the first place)

#5  alot of this type of music comes from either chicago or england.     
chicago is the originator of house music( late 70's) and england was
really  heavy into house music in the eighties before everyone started
talking about "electronica".  so this type of music has history and
sophistication.   i guess you could call it mature as an art form.

#5.a   san frandisco has a bunch of dj's from england and at least one
from chicago so these people have experienced house music that many of us
have never known if we have only been paying attention to dance music for
the last 5 years or so.   

so if alot dj's in sf aren't playing the latest progressive hits from
mixmag, 
or trying in vain to mix two dat tapes full of goa,  these might be some
of the reasons  ( in my opinion of course)

HOUSE MUSIC WILL NEVER DIE
peace
gabe

I picked up some decent "Happy Hardcore" on some Import CD's from "SU
Corporation" (aka Strictly Underground and Strictly Hardcore). I
actually got 'em real cheap in the Tower records "cutout" section in
Stonestown ('cept they no longer have a cutout section...). Some that I
recall off the top of my head are "Illegal Pirate Radio III" (1995) has
some decent H.H. and some non-intelligent (non-wimpy -- gunshots and
"boo-ya") style Jungle (2CD set)  Also picked up (import cutout again)
Rumour Records "Slammin Vinyl The Album" w/ DJ Red Alert, Mike SLammer,
Happy Tunes, and Midas.

Due to another post on this list, i now understand what that song
"Rushin' on Pink Champagne" (by Happy Tunes) is about. :-)

Course, I'm not much of a Happy Hardcore conoisseur or fan, so perhaps
some really cool into H.H. person is going to tell me I'm a clueless
loser for mentioning these CD's. (Go ahead, make my day...).

In a message dated 10/6/97 8:23:55 PM, you wrote:

<<He agreed to spin at *Play Nice* as a favor to Jenny and Nichole and
because of the fact that it was for a children's chairity.  He had plans to
spin at Life Force the night before and he turned down a paying job to drive
4 hours to Monterey.  He unfortunatlywas not able to get any sleep the night
before because he had a late spot at Life Force and he had stuff to do the
next day.  He drove up to Monterey to
spin and he was nothing less than pooped :-)>>

This has nothing to do with the fact that he and his 'manager' acted
foolishly. He knew how far Sac is from Monterrey, right? No one forced any of
the DJ's to go to the party. If he was that concerned about being tired maybe
he should have called ahead and not played at the party.

>>He was told that he was spinning @ 1 but when the sound showed up late, he
was told that he would be spinning a lot later than intended.>>

The same went for all of the other DJ's on the bill, and no one bitched that
much about it....

 >>He understood this and was very cool about it.  It was his manajor that
would not accept it.  He handled himself very poorly but he was drunk and a
little upset.>>

But his manager is representing him, so it may as well have been Mr. Bippy
yelling at Jeremy. The fact that he never stepped in to stop Mikey-wikey or
whatever meant that he felt the same about it. Mikey actually asked Re-Ach to
get off the decks. Do you think that if Re-Ach would have done that, that Mr.
Sippy would have said, "no that's OK, go ahead and finish?" I think not.

>>Something that I wanted everyone to understand is that the fight was never
about "peek hours" it was about Greg having to drive 4 hours home after
getting no sleep the night before.<<

Like I said earlier, he knew where the party was when he agreed to do it, so
what's with the primadonna attitude?

>>Greg didn't care when he went on, he offered to stay later.>>

Is that why he ended Re-Ach's last track a few minutes earlier than Re-Ach
asked him to, and then played an extra half an hour longer than he was
supposed to?

>>Once he went on, he was teased and mocked by some of the other DJ's.>>

Correction. he was 'teased and mocked' by one other DJ. That was me. I've
never done anything like that before, and I hope to never have to again. I've
had a lot of experiences in this DJ game, and I've had the pleasure of
handing the decks over to all kinds of people, from Garth to Afrika Bambaataa
and many more in between, and I have never seen such a display of straight-up
DJ bullshit. And then to get on the decks and exhibit no skills(IMO) and dis
a friend on top of it? Please. I felt like someone should've really let this
guy know he needed to check himself. I guess that was part of my job that
night.

>>Sorry for bringing up old business!  It was just something that I had to
get off my chest.  To anyone that now hates Mikey (Kid Bippy's manager); he
really isn't that bad...you just have to get to know him!  He was attempting
to stick up for a friend and I do respect that! >>

Maybe we could get Jr. Bippy and his manager online to share with us? Let's
all have a PLUR-ity fun fest together! Yeah!

Rave Ahead, dudes...

--Monty

ago.  It was supposed to signify a "special ingredient" (often ketamine)

I'll add my 2 cents now....

I've provided Management services for my clients and I am now an Agent
so I'm pretty aware of what it entails. But I also have to say I didn't
attend this party, just typing based upon what I've read so don't get
pissed if I'm a little off the mark.

I have never had a reason to be a bitch in public to anyone about the
way my clients have been treated. There is always a diplomatic way to
handle a situation.  We always want to remain professional.  Don't get
me wrong, if I have to give someone a piece of my mind, I'll do it and
do it well, but in a relatively private setting if possible. If the
other party refuses to comply, then my client and I calmly leave or we
can work out a way to get through whatever it is we are working on, but
we then NEVER work with that venue/person/group again! As their
representative, I also grant my clints the courtesy that I'll remain
sober so that if anything happens I'll be able to handle it. It sounds
to me that this manager of Kid Bippy's is either unclear on the concept
of his job or maybe made an agreement with his client that he was going
to party that night and mixed job with fun when a situation needed his
attention.....I agree with Beth, Greg gave his manager the freedom to
act in the manner he did, so it sounds like Greg doesn't know what his
managers' actions could do to his 'career' if that's what he's looking
for.  From the looks of the discussion here, it garnered quite a bit of
attention, not at all positive.  He's supposed to make Greg look GOOD,
not like some prissy DJ who needs a babysitter. Godd thing Greg has
friends who are willing to stick up for him and vouch for his
character.  His manager didn't do him any favors.

Anyway.....
Melissa

From: "peter sandifer" <boomerangflip@hotmail.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: What a meth!
Content-Type: text/plain
Date: Tue, 07 Oct 1997 16:09:38 PDT
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Every once in awhile, me and my boyz Slider and Duker get in the mood
for  a hardcore tweak-athon, so we pile in the ole Mustang with a bottle
of Jack and let the bass kick out the speakers, then we head on down to 
San Bernadino 
county to Jed Carter's Farm.

Jed Carter is the spacey old man who lives way out in the boondocks,
and every week he makes up a fresh batch of bathtub meth.  Sometimes
he does it when he's drunk and he'll end up collapsing a lung from 
breathing the chemicals, or setting hisself on fire, but most of 
the time his stuff is safe enough so we don't end up in the hospital.

Well, me and the boyz was pretty drunk by the time we got to the farm,
and we was all hollering,  "Hey Jed, we need lines of meth! Make us 
lines
of meth!"

So old Jed was agreeable, and told us to come back in an hour.  So we 
went into 
town and passed the time by slashing tires in the parking lot at
the town liberry; and then went back to Jed's Farm at the appointed
time.

Jed had this nasty old pile of powder for us, and we snorted it right
up the old snoot-hole, and MAAAAN did it burn!  Me and Slider and
Duke was hopping around with tears in our eyes, cussing and howling like
we was drunken sailors.

So we hopped in the old Mustang and headed up the interstate, and next 
thing I knew
the roof blew off the top of the car, and all the stars in the sky 
started 
turning purple and melting out of the sky.

"Gaw-jeez!"  I shouted, and next thing I knew, I woke up in the 
hospital.
I'd been in a coma damn near 6 weeks.  My boy Slider was sitting there
in a wheelchair, staring out the winder like a dummy, and my boy Duke 
was hooked up to life support drooling all over his self.

It took me weeks to recover, and even then my head was still screwed on 
back
asswards.  A couple weeks later I was down at the hardware store, and I 
ran into 
old Jed.

"Heyyy, Boomerang!"  sez Jed.  "How'd you like that insecticide I sold
 yous boyz?"

"Insecticide!"   sez I.  "Jed, Wot the hell you doing selling us
insecticide for?  We asked you  to make us lines of meth!"

Jed sez,  "Lines of meth?!  I thought you said you wanted me to make
your lives a mess!"

OK, since this conversation has revived itself, I'll spend my two cents.

Am I the only one who thinks this whole ridiculousness about Kid Bippy's
manager acting drunk and obnoxious is made even more weird by the fact that
.... um... Kid Bippy *has* a *manager*??

I mean, how many djs in the underground actually have a manager ....
someone to help get you bookings, maybe, but a *manager* who speaks on your
behalf like that like you can't do it yourself?  And to take themselves so
seriously that they throw a diva tantrum on the beach at an underground
party??  Oh please.

It's really the prima donna behavior that rubs people the wrong way... and
Kid Bippy/Greg needs to understand that his own personal reputation is at
stake if he allows others to speak for him.  My advice is, do it yourself,
Kid.  Then if there are problems, you can handle them the way you really
want, and people can make their judgments based on *your* behavior and not
his. A prima donna manager isn't doing you any favors in this scenario.
And to succeed in life, you'd best be able to manage your own stuff, cuz no
one will do it the way you will, I promise.

Old school music, new school music, ain't the issue really, I bet we
wouldn't have heard the complaints if it weren't for the other behavior
that night.

I've never heard Kid Bippy spin, but I'm sure that there are a few less
jobs waiting for him out there than there were before this happened, even
if he is the next DJ Dan (and whoever said Madame Mercury/Sherry doesn't
know about DJ Dan doesn't know about Sherry).  Lesson learned.

Leslie

Yup Yup Yup!!! Great stuff this tryptophan! I have a whole bottle of the
stuff at home. Works the same way as Prozac. Increases seratonin levels
in the brain.
By itself it makes you feel really loopy or giddy. Makes you kinda
drowsy. Mental changes similar to that of a very mild dose of psyclobin
or "shrooms".
I call it the un-spun pill. Hahaha.
Go get some at your health food stores. More potent than the 5 hydroxy
tryptophan is "L-tryptophan".
Love,
Paul*E*Wog

Asstropup@aol.com wrote:
> 
> Hi all!
> 
> don't know if anyone's ever posted anything about this, so excuz if so:
> 
> have read that one of the things E does is deplete seratonin levels in the
> brain. this is what gives some that washed-out, kind of depressed feeling
> after a night of partying. long-term, depleted levels of seratonin have been
> shown to lead to bad stuff (severe depression, sleep disorders, etc.).
> 
>  I decided to do a little medical experiment on myself based on the above
> (and a friend joined me, purely of her own free will I might add). I went to
> a health food store and asked if their was any food suppliment that could
> counteract seratonin loss. Guy immediatly told me about tryptophan (full name
> 5-hydroxy l-tryptophan or 5-htp) an amino acid that occurs naturally in some
> foods (it's the stuff in turkey that makes you sleepy). 5-htp is the
> immediate precursor to seratonin production.
> 
> So anyway we took a couple of these babies on Sunday as we were coming down
> after a complete night of dancing (weee!) and indulging. The difference for
> both of us was really wild. felt much more alert and happy than usual, almost
> complete lack of the normal edginess, and just generally more at peace with
> the world. When i ended up getting to bed around 2:00 i almost instantly fell
> blissfully asleep. my friend kelly also had the same reaction.
> 
> i know this is completely unscientific and the placebo effect could always be
> a factor. but I also know my body pretty well and it had never felt this good
> after a serious night like this one.
> 
> let me know if anyone else has tried it.
> 
> PLUR++,
> 
> brian
> 
> p.s. i have nothing to do with any entity that could profit from this stuff.
> purely a public service.

I'm not sure, but I believe there was also a strong push from
pharmaceutical companies to make tryptophan illegal because it competed
with their anti-depressants.  grrr...  

Another snippet of info about tryptophan.  Tryptophan is a precursor to
tryptamine, which is a precursor to many of our favorite entheogenic
substances; psilocin, dmt, mescaline.  As such, tryptophan has been used
in the growth substrate of p. cubensis mushrooms to increase psilocin
concentrations.  Voila, super silly fungi.  Maybe a little too strong for
the majority of this list. Don't try it at home, kids. ;)

ttl,
george

> contamination at the manufacturer even though it was purchased at
> regular drug stores. I don't remember exactly what happened to you,

Dear Natasha,
What HAS been banned from health food stores is something known as
"L-Tryptohan". That is the chemical version of it.
"5-hydroxy-tryptophan" is the natural supplement of it. It's extracted
from beans. Tryptophan is an essential amino acid that we need to be
alive. Protein!
Love,
Paul*E*Wog

Natasha426@aol.com wrote:
> 
> In a message dated 10/7/97 1:54:33 AM, you wrote:
> 
> <<I went to
> a health food store and asked if their was any food suppliment that could
> counteract seratonin loss. Guy immediatly told me about tryptophan (full name
> 5-hydroxy l-tryptophan or 5-htp) an amino acid that occurs naturally in some
> foods (it's the stuff in turkey that makes you sleepy). 5-htp is the
> immediate precursor to seratonin production. >>
> 
> Well, my main question here, which leads me to be very skeptical of your
> claim, is that tryptophan has been banned by the FDA from sale in the US.
>  so, you can't just "pop into a local health food store" and buy some -- so
> was it really tryptophan that you were taking, or just some hokey bunk stuff
> that this guy was trying to sell you just to make a buck.??
> 
> luv n hugs,
> natasha

dear melissa,

the two times i have seen kid bippy i said to myself what a nice guy..

i like the fact that he puts d & B into a tekno house mix.  not afraid 
to cross barriers.  i like that..... then i saw him one time on haight 
street.  at that time he was just starting to get gigs in the bay area 
and we talked about dj who from where he's from and we talked record 
shops and he said that he had passed out 35 or so tapes b4 he got a gig.  
honest dj advice.  i have had pleasant experiences with him.  

i know nothing of the drama that ensued upon the decks at such and such 
a party, but i hold promoters entirely responsible for sticking to their 
line-up schedule in a timely fashion or working it out between the acts 
that they have booked. remember, dj's are artists foremost. hence, there 
must oft times be a lubricant promoter to ease out the differences in 
enlarged egos.  when i throw a party i do it. sometimes it has taken up 
most of my partying time, but i make sure that the show goes smoothly.  

get over it, just listen to the music........dj jakeloco 
>I'll add my 2 cents now....
>
>I've provided Management services for my clients and I am now an Agent
>so I'm pretty aware of what it entails. But I also have to say I didn't
>attend this party, just typing based upon what I've read so don't get
>pissed if I'm a little off the mark.
>
>I have never had a reason to be a bitch in public to anyone about the
>way my clients have been treated. There is always a diplomatic way to
>handle a situation.  We always want to remain professional.  Don't get
>me wrong, if I have to give someone a piece of my mind, I'll do it and
>do it well, but in a relatively private setting if possible. If the
>other party refuses to comply, then my client and I calmly leave or we
>can work out a way to get through whatever it is we are working on, but
>we then NEVER work with that venue/person/group again! As their
>representative, I also grant my clints the courtesy that I'll remain
>sober so that if anything happens I'll be able to handle it. It sounds
>to me that this manager of Kid Bippy's is either unclear on the concept
>of his job or maybe made an agreement with his client that he was going
>to party that night and mixed job with fun when a situation needed his
>attention.....I agree with Beth, Greg gave his manager the freedom to
>act in the manner he did, so it sounds like Greg doesn't know what his
>managers' actions could do to his 'career' if that's what he's looking
>for.  From the looks of the discussion here, it garnered quite a bit of
>attention, not at all positive.  He's supposed to make Greg look GOOD,
>not like some prissy DJ who needs a babysitter. Godd thing Greg has
>friends who are willing to stick up for him and vouch for his
>character.  His manager didn't do him any favors.
>
>Anyway.....

Date: Tue, 7 Oct 1997 17:28:20 -0700 (PDT)
From: "Puddin N' Pie"   <gchan@best.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: NO TV: review
Message-ID: <Pine.BSF.3.96.971007170237.29525D-100000@shell7.ba.best.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


Okie dokes, NO TV! was refreshingly different from Sf's other clubs.
The main floor of 1015 folsom was transformed into a gigantic living room.
They brought down all the couches and set them up along the walls, and
in the middle or the room facing the sound/light pod.  Platters of fresh
fruit, assorted candies at the bar.  Oh so yummy.

(Yikes, San Bernadino mud fest, and SNOW in the Sierra!!)  

First thing I hear when I walk in is Pink Floyd, so I immediately plop my
ass down on a couch in front of the lowered giant disco ball and listen
to the mellow ambient and trip out to the light show.  I meditated for
about an hour on the couch, listening to sounds of nature layered with
lush lyrical synth orchestrations.  So nice to have a bowl, chill out and
wind down from the weekend.  

And then the ambient turns into an easy downtempo groove.  I get up and
relocated to another couch, where I get a fresh perspective of lights
and sound.  It really was a showcase for the lighting/visual guys in the
beginning of the evening.  I have a much higher appreciation for those
guys.  Anyways, the music goes through a series of smooth transitions
until it hits some deep house, and that's where it stayed.  The bass was
pounding its steady four four, and people grooved out on the floor.  I
would have liked to have been taken to some breakbeats.

I really liked that the music and atmosphere followed a story line.
Ambient to relax, let go, chill, meet other peeps.  Call it preparation
for a spiritual dance gathering.  I believe more raves should start out
like this so everyone can start off at the same level.  Anyone know what
I'm talking about?  Props to the djs for such a difficult job of raising
the energy level by small notches to draw in the dancers.  Damn, that's a
whole sociological mind game djs have to play. 

Well, I had a good time, and will probably go again.  Does anybody know if
you can get underage people in through the guest list?  Will they check
IDs?  If they don't then maybe I can bring in some of you underaged peeps
in.

Have a good week,
george
