To: various@creativity.net
From: ccafe@creativity.net (Creativity Cafe)
Subject: (10/6/97) V.A.R.I.O.U.S. Media Ink: Future Mailings: KidCast UpDate
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Greetings Friends of Creativity Cafe , Art and Technology,

Welcome to V.A.R.I.O.U.S. Media Ink; Newsletter of Visionary Artists
Resources Including Other Unique Services and Creativity Cafe.

This is one of the last KidCast specific editions posted to our general
(V.A.R.I.O.U.S.) email list. As we near the KidCast date of Nov. 17,
production will speed up. Many of you, understandably, won't want to be
bothered with the KidCast coordination mailings, and will be spared.  :-)

The KidCast mailing list (kidcast@envirolink.org), donated by KidCast
sponsor, Envirolink, will soon be in operation to handle KidCast traffic.
If you are interested, KidCast Central and our Community Forum will have
the latest developments.  There you will find digests of KidCast messages
of note in our KidCast Conversations area. Significant KidCast updates and
news of interest to our readership, will be posted in future editions of
VMI as time permits.

We are delighted at the development of a fantastic "KidCast For Peace" web
site created by KidCast sponsor The Mining Company's guide Diane Dobbs,
publisher of Creative Writing For Kids...A big round of applause for her
efforts!!!  The first entry for KidCast#5 has been submitted there...a very
moving piece provicated by a UFO visitation.  It brought tears to my
eyes...check it out at:
http://kidswriting.tqn.com/library/blank/blconts.htm#cckfp .

The Maui Research and Technology Park has made a KidCast committment
offering a teleconferencing room, computer and high bandwidth Internet
connection for CU-SeeMe. A Maui co-producer is still needed to ground the
energy there. Thanks to volunteer, Jennifer Melnick, we are developing
Creativity Cafe's KidCast Central page to have an improved user interface.
You may check out Jennifer's work--which includes being lead designer for
U.S. Vice President Al Gore's "National Education Website," at:
http://www.slip.net/~melnick/portfolio .

V.A.R.I.O.U.S. was at The Seybold Convention all last week overlapping with
the Children's Interactive Expo, at Fort Mason in San Francisco. Lots of
little bodies, lots of big Sony Computers. Fantastic KidCast connections
were made--reports on both to be posted in the CC Community Forum when time
permits.

Macromedia, longtime VARIOUS supporter takes over this week with their
annual user's Conference:
http://www.macromedia.com/macromedia/events/ucon97/. Their creative tools
continue to easily liberate the multimedia storyteller.  This reporter will
be  hosting a "New School For the Next Millennium" Birds of A Feather (BOF)
session at the upcoming Avatar97 conference, produced by Bruce Damer of the
Contact Consortium: http://www.ccon.org/ .

Got a call from NY SIGGRAPH last night. They will be helping put the NY
KidCast end together at their 5th Annual Digital Salon in cooperation with
the School of Visual Arts. At Seybold, Intergraph seemed interested in
grounding KidCast at COMDEX (boy, doesn't *that* have a nice ring to it?
:-). That will take some followup bandwidth I won't have for a while.
Any connection into Comdex anyone might afford is very appreciated :-)

We'd like to hear from you....
Please offer your feedback about this mailing and give us a clue about how
*your* life is unfolding by posting in Creativity Cafe's Community Forum:
http://creativity.net/cgi-bin/nu4m/cc4m/index.cgi.

Lastly... We thank Raines Cohen, editor of NeT Professional
(editor@NeTProLive.com), for the first "in-print" KidCast call that we know
of (http://www.NeTProLive.com), and want to turn you on to Jan Shepherd's
Project Mind Foundation; the latest to link to Creativity Cafe. Project
Mind Foundation's vision: "to free the human spirit from the crushing
illusion of materialism by using the transformative genius, latent in all
humans, to eliminate real and addictive lack":
http://www.webscope.com/project_mind/project_mind.html .

Have a happy, expressive and loving day.
With aloha,
-Peter=>
********************************************
   Facilitating the expression of artists
       using technology for Humanity
********************************************
Peter H. Rosen
Founder: Visionary Artists' Resources Including Other Unique Services
Founder and Executive Coordinator: Creativity Cafe
2263 Sacramento St., #2
San Francisco, CA 94115
415.776.0821 (VOX/FAX)
peter@creativity.net
Creativity Cafe on the World Wide Web:
http://creativity.net

By the way, tryptophan is NOT an illegal substance in the US.  It is
just that now it is available only by MD or ND (naturopathic doctor)
prescription, thus it costs a lot more than it did when it was
over-the-counter.  The "smart drug" companies that sell it get around
this by marketing what they sell as "animal grade".  I have some of this
form of tryptophan though I am a little weirded out by doing "animal
grade" stuff!

When it was taken off the market for several years because some people
contracted EMS (eosinophilia myalgia syndrome), it was proven that ALL
of these people had taken tryptophan that was made by the SAME Japanese
manufacturer (even though under different brand names, which is how most
supplements are sold; there are very few actual manufacturers).   SO
now, years later, it has finally been returned to the market, but only
by prescription and the cost is way up...crazy FDA bullshit, for sure.

I'd love to hear more about this tryptophan to tryptamine conversion.  I
have a book on amino acids and it says nothing about this.  Tryptophan
is coverted to serotonin.  Vitamin B-6 and C apparentely aid in this
process.  Whoever wrote about "4-8 mg of tryptophan is like 4 mg of
psilocybin" is out there a bit...active doses of the former are around
1000 mg (1 g) and the latter, well, at least a gram or two (not mg).

X-Mailer: Mozilla 3.01Gold (Macintosh; U; PPC)
MIME-Version: 1.0
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: RE:CardstockIn response to:
	"for most of the reasonably glossy flyers that are printed on cardstock,
	how
	much is the duplication cost (on average)?  and how many usually get
	printed up for massives?"
	Duplication costs will depend on size of run. Will you print 5,000 or
	50,000? The price per unit will go down with a greater quantity. How big
	will the finished flyer be? This will determine how many can be printed
	on 1 press sheet. The more the less expensive, up to a point. If the
	flyers have to be printed on a bigger press they'll charge you a higher
	hourly rate for that. Other factors which have less effect are the
	thickness of the stock? The thicker, the more expensive. What are you
	going to do with the flier afterwards? Will it lie flat, fold in half,
	french fold, letter fold, etc? The more complicated, the more expensive.
	Tell the printer what you want and ask for a quote. Shop around. A
	former rave promoter told me that he would get about a 10% response
	rate.
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

In response to:

"for most of the reasonably glossy flyers that are printed on cardstock,
how
much is the duplication cost (on average)?  and how many usually get
printed up for massives?"


Duplication costs will depend on size of run. Will you print 5,000 or
50,000? The price per unit will go down with a greater quantity. How big
will the finished flyer be? This will determine how many can be printed
on 1 press sheet. The more the less expensive, up to a point. If the
flyers have to be printed on a bigger press they'll charge you a higher
hourly rate for that. Other factors which have less effect are the
thickness of the stock? The thicker, the more expensive. What are you
going to do with the flier afterwards? Will it lie flat, fold in half,
french fold, letter fold, etc? The more complicated, the more expensive.
Tell the printer what you want and ask for a quote. Shop around. A
former rave promoter told me that he would get about a 10% response
rate.

Who?
 The sun is our God. We are the energy from within it. We were born because
our sun managed to grow in a fairly stable position around our galaxy. I
believe the electricity flowing through-out our brain & spine will keep
it's cohesion after our death. Taking our consciousness, our memories, and
our personalities with it. I believe we all float off as energy beings when
we die. I believe there are many beings within our sun that are very wise,
feeding off the suns energy.. .. 
 I believe that someday we will all meet the center of our galaxy.. And
someday be sucked into, yet another consciousness on the other side, where
our galaxy will finally travel..Billions of years from now.
 You see.. We are all a part of this HUGE galaxy we call the milky way. All
our galaxy is, is a spark in the fabric of time and space. In simpler
terms..It's just a + and then it's a -. Here today, gone tomorrow.. imagine
a flower blooming in the morning light. How it twists out of it's curled up
sleep, and then at night how it curl's back into a pod. Thats all we our! A
part of an enormous flower! A flower of light, energy, and matter. Curling
out into this void, and sucking it's way back into the minus. .
 Were all going to die! No. We will all see are galaxy unfold it's self
someday. Someday we will watch our flower be pulled into it's own weight,
into the unimaginable...  

And these are just my beliefs ofcourse.. But alot of it has fact. And alot
of facts without answers.. 

Anyways. Gotta jet.. Praise the lord our sun.
And you BETTER be greatfull that our sun is still here on Christmas. That
is, if your so stuck on this state of flesh and blood.

=]:...
Jeff

In a message dated 97-10-08 00:10:27 EDT, you write:

<< At 05:45 PM 10/7/97 -0700, T. Mulligan wrote:
 >>process.  Whoever wrote about "4-8 mg of tryptophan is like 4 mg of
 >>psilocybin" is out there a bit...active doses of the former are around
 >>1000 mg (1 g) and the latter, well, at least a gram or two (not mg).
 >>
 >>
 
 > Psilocybin is active at about 5-8 mg.  that's from the psilocybin
mushrooms
 >faq.  it's because the mushrooms aren't 100% psilocybin that the active
 >dose is grams of mushrooms, not mg. >>

5-8mg is probably psychoactive, but  in a gram of mushrooms there is usually
about 20 mg of psilocybin and psilocin (they both become psilocin when they
enter your body). so eating a fourth of a gram really isnt that much, like a
fractrion of a cap or something pretty small. NEwayz, i read a report on the
toxicity of psilocybin that said that 13grams of pure psilocybin was injected
intraveneously and after a few dayz of pure psychosis, the guy was still
alive. lets see... if there is about 20mg in a gram of dried shrooms then
youd have to eat 650grams of mushrooms to get that much psilocybin.
uhhhh...... maybe i read that wrong, thats like a pound and a half.
 YYYYUUUUCCCCKKK!!!!!!!!!!

On Tue, 7 Oct 1997 19:43:45 -0700 "Mr nStuff" <stuff@hooked.net> writes:
>Who?
> The sun is our God. We are the energy from within it.

this is a nice view of life

It reminds me of an indian story about how a long time ago
there was a huge star(sun) that contained all life and it exploded...
In the heart of each human and living being is a fragment of that star.

Thru our life we are tested by having water thrown on us and the 
ones that survive the pain are made stronger and stronger
each time they have a struggle. Eventually they grow so strong
and powerful that they become a star...When our heart becomes
so strong and full of love that it shines everyday for all without
judgement then it takes its place in the sky and when it becomes
strong enough it dances with other stars and gives birth to planets.
And these planets eventually give birth to more vehicles to carry
more starseeds. One day all these starseeds will reunite and 
create the next cycle.

Its kind of nice to look at the sky at night especially at
one of these great outdoor parties we had this summer
and see each of those dancing lights in the sky as someone's
heart. Sometimes you can even find the heart of your own
ancestors twinkling at you ...perhaps that wonderful friend
that you once played with is there beaming a message to 
you...listen and sometimes you can hear them speak to you.

Of coarse in our modern world you have to be careful and make sure
that twinkling in the sky is not microsofts new satelite or something.
That would be sad if you thought you were talking to your dead
ancestors and you got a message to upgrade to windows 98.

	><{{{">  <"}}}><

		foolish fish

impossible to OD on shrooms because a human stomach cannot ingest that
many mushrooms. Although I know that pure LSD25

crap. I mean like black gels. Ya know the stuff w/o the speed or
strychnine. Oh. And Tryptophan is NOT a drug it is an amino acid that is
in the sausage & pepperoni that i am eating right now!

Regarding Life, God, or being happy you guys might be interested in a 
book entitled "The 12th Planet"  It is about a theory that we were all 
brought here by an alien civilization millions of years ago and "planted 
a seed by which everything were to blossom from"  The book has facts, 
ancient drawings and other neato stuff to prove the theory, I don't 
believe it though, but that is my opinion.

>  I met an unusual person this morning, they said that their name was 
>Life.  I was not aware of this Life person but there she was.  Divine, 
>broad, and smiling.
>  She reached her arm out gently to me in a white, satin gown and said 
>in a soft, relaxing voice, "bABy HueY, you must love me for I am not 
>immortal, and neither are you.  You need to respect and cherish me.  I 
>am your destiny.  
>  Breath bAByHueY, breath in the warmth and love that you and I share 
>together.  Breath in the friends of whom you love and care about.  
>Breath every moment of every beautiful minute in which millions of your 
>people are doing the same.  Breath, breath, breath."
>  "Ooohh!" I thought, "this is some kind of awakening or something."  
>This person kind of scared me in a way that nothing else can. But being 
>the curious guy that I am, I listened to her voice some more.
>  "bAByHueY, You need to accept who you are and who the people are that 
>you love, and love them.  Give them all that you can give them. Give 
>them a piece of your heart, a piece of your soul, and a piece of your 
>destiny.  Days are days, and forever is forever.  Memories are forever.  
>Let's both become one individual and make all the happiest memories 
that 
>we can.  Let's breath together the same air, the same love and the same 
>ambitions for I have not known you until today.  And together we can 
cry 
>happily forever, beyond memories.
>
>* I just wanted everyone out there to breath the same air that I am 
>breathing. and for someone to rent with me J/k  :P
>Tomorrow, when most of you will read this, remember that today is not 
>going to be what happened yesterday, it is new, and with all new 
things, 
>we must learn and use to the best of our capabilities.*
>
>bAByHueY

My opinion of life and a superior entity consists of this:

I believe that human beings were seen as an intelligent/unique/? enough
life form to receive somewhat of an "enhancement" by being given the highest amount
of "lifeforce" given to any creature on earth. I feel that we're all
connected through this lifeforce and this is simply a phase an an infinite
existence. By being placed on this "Earth" we're giving the opportunity to
communicate and exist with other life forms to increase our spiritual
understanding and in turn return our enhanced "lifeforce" back to the
collective consciousness that is this "great lifeforce". 

I've always felt that there was something beyond this. I knew it. But I
couldn't believe that religion was completely true. I feel that there is
good and evil, and that this lifeforce has given us this great opportunity
because it cared about us. They didn't want us to feel pain and agony
but knew that it was part of the entire experience. It's someone of a sad
reality but it just makes me even more happy to be alive and to have all
the good friends I have now. I'm 21 years old and am coming to a better
and better understanding of where I am in this infinite *space* and how I
can keep my feet on the ground, turn around, blink my eyes, and focus on
*today* and be content. We're always in a rush to do nothing. I'm
striving to be as content walking down the street to Bart as I am laying
in bed watching Looney Tunes. Because in essence the amount of time I
spend doing each is equally as valuable in the sand glass of my life. 

Ultimately I must focus on what matters to me and live my life focusing on
that. The values and goals of others are irrelevant in my journey through
this life experience. Meaning that I need to follow my dreams and not
judge them by other people standards, point of view, values, etc. There
are so many people living their lives trying to find something they're
never going to find. When all they need to do is open their eyes and
realize how much they're taking for granted all the time. We've all been
blessed and no matter what happens after *this*, we have *this* now and
let us enjoy *this* to the fullest extreme.

Ring, ring.... gotta run. Customer!

Byroni! ;)

St johns wort, a herb used for centuries to treat depression might
also be used to counteract the negative effects E

It is even being used by american doctors as an alternative to prozac
and is not only much cheaper than prozac it is also more effective
and has no side effects. I dont know if it could be used in a similar
way as some of the other substances being discussed in this thread
but it might be worth looking into. 

Also DHEA is something to check out if you dont have the same amount
of energy that you did when you were 16. It does however have one
side effect...it gives you the libido of a 16 year old. It only costs
about
3-4 dollars a bottle so give it a try. Educate yourself with a web search
first.

and lets not forget the non drug methods of feeling good ...like raving.

Precedence: bulk

This was cute.  Warning for you guys on sfraves, cuz I know how you can be
- don't take this too seriously...


>[Picked this up when it was forwarded to Boston-Raves]
>
><quote>
>
>This was posted to pb-cle-raves...re: "the origin of jungle"
>
>Subterra3 (subterra3@aol.com) wrote:
>: SUBTERRA MAGAZINE   (based in Atlanta) wants to know how you think jungle
>: came to be.  Your response maybe be published in our next issue.
>: Peace all.
>
>Okay.  Upton Sinclair wrote _The Jungle_ in 1906.  At or around that time,
>he also sent a cassette of music to accompany the book to Benjamin
>Franklin, who was then the ambassador to France.  This tape was labeled
>"Jungle" and consisted of very fast, percussive and repetitive music that
>Sinclair had composed to try to convey the experience of working in an
>automated meatpacking plant (remember, this is in Chicago, which later
>became the home of the Hard Core Meat Beat scene).  In Britain, Rudyard
>Kipling had penned _The Jungle Book_ in 1894 and was experimenting with
>the fusion of "fife and drum" or bagpipe military music with Tabla rhythms
>imported from the Indian colony.  Kipling's close friend, Field Marshall
>the Viscount Montgomery of Alamein, known also as Rude Bwoy Monty, was
>intrigued by the new sounds that Kipling was creating and made a
>dubplate to play at social events at the officers club.  The new music
>quickly spread to all corners of the then-vast British Empire, thus
>creating what we know today as "jungle." So, you see, it's really not as
>new as you thought...m@
>
></quote>

---foolish_fish1@juno.com wrote:
>
> 
> St johns wort, a herb used for centuries to treat depression might
> also be used to counteract the negative effects E
> 
> It is even being used by american doctors as an alternative to prozac
> and is not only much cheaper than prozac it is also more effective
> and has no side effects. I dont know if it could be used in a similar
> way as some of the other substances being discussed in this thread
> but it might be worth looking into. 

yup... i've read that st johns wort the most popular anti-depressant
in germany (outsells prozac 7 to 1). one thing to consider tho is the
effect on serotonin levels... not all anti-depressants are ssri's, and
i'm not really sure that if they weren't (an ssri) that it would
counteract the drop in serotonin levels after taking e. i believe that
st johns wort (or hypericum) is more along the lines of a tricyclic
antidepressant, and i'm not remembering now how these work exactly.
anyway i suppose it couldn't hurt to try it out! (disclaimer - i'm not
responsible for any of you who choose to mix herbs and drugs... be
aware that some herbs are very powerful and can even be toxic. there
are no fda regulations on any of these. don't know about the effects
of st johns wort mixed with anything tho.)
> 
> Also DHEA is something to check out if you dont have the same amount
> of energy that you did when you were 16. It does however have one
> side effect...it gives you the libido of a 16 year old.

hmmmm... the libido of a 16 year old? i'd have to think about that.
i'm sort of enjoying my 30 year old one at the moment!  the only thing
i know about dhea is that it raises the levels of 6 different
hormones, and girls - high doses can increase your facial hair.  eeeew!

> and lets not forget the non drug methods of feeling good ...like
raving.

cheers - e. :)

		Can some one tell me whats going on? Why is it every time I check my mail I
see negitive remark after negitive remark? I am really tierd of this, what
has happend to the scene? I mean come on people how this list and scene has
been for the last couple months SUCKS!

and whos not!
This kinda shit is exactly why I havent partied in a while. Its all been
about who did or said this, thats not what I rember this collective comunity
being about!
	
	I envoled myself in the scene because I belived in what it represented. I
belived in the scene, I belived in the people, and I belived in PLUR. Now to
see it this way crushes a part of my heart. I think we all have seen a
downfall in the scene, you can blame it on whatever you would like, but in
reality only we are to blame.By promoting unexcepitable behavior, commments,
actions ect. we are keeping things from getting better, and belive me they
are just getting worse. Sooner or later people there wont realisticly be a
scene based on Peace, Love, Unity, and Respect.... AT ALL! We are the only
ones that can keep our scene alive, and we can keep it alive through love, or
we can keep it alive through negitivity, its our choice!

	Take what Ive said and analize it, disect it, flame it how ever you would
like, or you can stop take a look at yourself and change it, its all up to
you!

	

	Amanda

kay this is sort of a response to all the housing posts as of late.

Me and my roommates have moved out from our old apartment and our oh so cool
of a landlord(the reason we left) has sold it to a nice family. But they 
would like to rent it out for 6 months while they are back in china.

Here are the low down details.

The address is 400 ortega avenue. On the corner of latham and ortega
in mountain view. its a second floor corner apartment, so on a nice day
with all the windows open you get a cool breeze.  That street tends to be noisy though.  Its two bedroom, one bath but has two sinks. One acutally in the 
bathroom and one out.  Nie large living room but the kitchen is kinda small.

Rent is $1200 a month, plus you need to pay for electric.

My only real complaint is that most of the people there are either elderly 
couples or new families so the place was quiet.  Towards the end we did get a 
few noise complaints.

If anyone is interested please emiail me.  I still have keys and can show you
around.  

herb

>Hey Kids,

>		Can some one tell me whats going on? Why is it every time I

I don't think anything has happened except for people evolving (if I may be
so bold) into habits or expectations of what they expect from a party or
this scene.

The honeymoon is over for many I guess.  What suprises me is the RATE of
burnout.  I mean, I became somewhat jaded after the first 5 years of
raving, it took that long.  Now people go into it full bore, then become
disillusioned after less than a year?  I don't get it.

>I mean come on people how this list and scene has
>been for the last couple months SUCKS!

And this is positive commentary?  Sometimes things start with you.  The
scene hasn't gotten any worse or better.  People still seem to be having a
good time at parties, as well as bad times.


>It really hurts me to read things that are really based on whos an asshole
>and whos not!
>This kinda shit is exactly why I havent partied in a while. Its all been
>about who did or said this, thats not what I rember this collective comunity
>being about!

Collective?  To what ends?  I have never seen this scene or any other scene
spawned from this to be anything more than entertainment.  To me at least
it isn;t a movement, just a party or series of parties with good/bad
intentions.

>
>	I envoled myself in the scene because I belived in what it represented.

Other than music and dancing together what *did* this represent to you and
how did you come to that conclusion?


>I
>belived in the scene, I belived in the people, and I belived in PLUR. Now to
>see it this way crushes a part of my heart. I think we all have seen a
>downfall in the scene, you can blame it on whatever you would like, but in
>reality only we are to blame.

The downfall...we come full circle witrh this one once a month it seems.
There is no downfall of anything, there is nothign falling, there is
nothing being dismantled, and there is nothing there that wasn;t there
before.  Maybe people are beginning to wake up and see this for what it
really is...a party.  Pretty much it, the rest is people putting thier
ideals onto a party whose primary purpose is fun and escape.

>By promoting unexcepitable behavior, commments,
>actions ect. we are keeping things from getting better, and belive me they
>are just getting worse. Sooner or later people there wont realisticly be a
>scene based on Peace, Love, Unity, and Respect.... AT ALL!

It has never been based on those elements.  It has however been based on
beats, booty, booze, and copius amounts of drugs.  In other words F U N,
*not* P L U R.

> We are the only
>ones that can keep our scene alive, and we can keep it alive through love, or
>we can keep it alive through negitivity, its our choice!

No you are not.  The scene has been going strong for years with new people
showing up all the time.  When someone disappears, there is a new
personalitiy or personalities to take teir place.  As long as people like
music, beats, booty, dancing, drugs, this scene will thrive, as it has for
damn near a DECADE!

>
>	Take what Ive said and analize it, disect it, flame it how ever you
>would
>like, or you can stop take a look at yourself and change it, its all up to

Hmmm.... Didn't have any effect on me. I take Phosphidyl Choline(a lot,10 a day)
every day which did have a marked effect on my moods and energy
level(which is why I take it regularly.) I decided to try DHEA, and just
got finished taking 50mg a day for two months and... nothing. So as with
all things YMMV(your mileage may vary.)

You said it right girlfriend!!!  I am so tired of hearing people restating
the facts about this Kid Bippy deal, and all the other stuff that people have
been arguing about lately...  I think that people need to realise that these
are personality conflicts between different people that dont necessarily have
to have the same opinions...Not everybody needs to aggree with everybody
else, we are all different, but we all don't need to try to conform others to
have the same beliefs as us either.  (obviously)  
So, please remember why you go to raves, why you are a part of this scene,
and why you like to be on the SF rave mailing list.... I am because i love
being a part of a group of people that is like a giant extended family to me.
 Having moved here not too long ago, and recently entering the scene here, i
love being a part of this in SF, and it is great to know that we are all
here, supporting each other, going to excellent parties, doing fantastic
drugs- and sometimes not so fantastic- hugging, plurring, loving, crying,
laughing, and listening to each other.  But mostly and more importantly,
having fun!!!!!!!


~~~~Keeping the PLUR alive~~~~
Loving you all,
Maya

On Wed, 8 Oct 1997 Amandust3@aol.com wrote:

> Hey Kids,
> 
> 		Can some one tell me whats going on? Why is it every time I check my mail I
> see negitive remark after negitive remark? I am really tierd of this, what
> has happend to the scene? 

Nothing, S.F Raves is not "the scene." Most likely you have noticed this
behaviour in the circle of people in *your* scene. 


> I mean come on people how this list and scene has been for the last
> couple months SUCKS! It really hurts me to read things that are really 
> based on whos an asshole and whos not!

Then don't read them.

> This kinda shit is exactly why I havent partied in a while. Its all been
> about who did or said this, thats not what I rember this collective comunity
> being about!

It rather amusing actually. Every couple of months(weeks?) someone comes
along and posts something very much along the lines of what you posted, as
if, somehow, the sky is falling.

The world hasn't suddenly changed. In all likelyhood *you've* changed.
The newness is wearing off, and as you become more ingrained in a group of
people you begin to realize that "Wow, there is attitude, backstabbing,
gossip, etc." in every "scene." 

Or maybe you are going to parties that are encouraging everyone in the
world to attend, advertising at malls, high schools, etc. What kind of
people do you think are going to show up? That is the problem with
speaking in absolutes: "Oh yeah PLUR!!!! We are all one people, one
vibe, etc." Well, there are a lot of people out there that would(and do) 
seek advantage in that attitude. To them it is an opportunity waiting to
be exploited. 
 	
> 	I envoled myself in the scene because I belived in what it represented. I
> belived in the scene, I belived in the people, and I belived in PLUR. Now to
> see it this way crushes a part of my heart. 

Then you better move on before it kills you, if it is truly bringing you
down as much as you say. Why stick around something that is harmful?
Sounds very self-destructive..

> I think we all have seen a downfall in the scene, you can blame it on
> whatever you would like, but in reality only we are to blame.

I haven't seen a downfall in anything. All I have seen is people being
people. On the one hand they can be wondeful, caring , full of love
and other they can be horrible, spiteful, and cruel. Do you actually think
that your take on the "scene" isn't something that many, many people have
not expressed on and off the list before? Pop, there goes that bubble.

> Sooner or later people there wont realisticly be a
> scene based on Peace, Love, Unity, and Respect.... AT ALL! We are the only
> ones that can keep our scene alive, and we can keep it alive through love, or
> we can keep it alive through negitivity, its our choice!

Yawn. 

> 	Take what Ive said and analize it, disect it, flame it how ever you would
> like, or you can stop take a look at yourself and change it, its all up to
> you!

I would suggest that you do some soul searching and determine how much of
these changes are external, and how many are really internal.

					Black Adder

On Wed, 8 Oct 1997, Chris Porter wrote:

> Well, Bi-Polar-Manic-Depressive-Fruit-Loop-itis runs in my family. (ha-ha
> not funny really...) My dad has always been opposed to Prozac, lithium and
> the like, but ironically enough, this summer he lost it, completely, ended
> up in the hospital.  ("It" being sanity)  His doctors were pretty upset
> when he mentioned St Johns wort.  Anyway, he tried it instead of the Prozac
> they prescribed... 2-weeks later he was back in the hospital :-\   As a
> side note, Prozac didn't do the trick either, Lithium seems to be helping
> though...

Exactly. Lithium is used in cases of severe chemical imbalance(and is not 
an SSRI to the best of my knowledge), and if it helping, I am not suprised
that St. John's or Prozac wouldn't have worked.

Anti-depressants are an imprecise science at best, having witnessed how
the decision of what to prescribe is handled. Basically, they diagnose a
person, which usually defines the class of drug they are going to. Then
they use you as a guniea pig, trying out various drugs in that class until
they find something that seems to work, or they switch classes of drugs
and start all over. I've seen it happen.


					Black Adder

Message-Id: <v0310280bb0611d222b46@[205.162.25.58]>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
From: "John S. Lee" <jsl@nexsys.net>
Subject: NRR:  Movie to see
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

It is rare that I post a NRR, but after watching a movie with my Megan last
night I had to chime in for this rare momentary lapse of strict protocol I
adhere to.  You, and yes I mean you, should watch Rosewood by John
Singleton.

I think it is one of the most important movies of the 90's for certain.  I
also think that what happens (the story of Rosewood is entirely TRUE) is a
reminder of where we are today in terms of ourselves as a nation and as
races of people.

I know many hate when we begin to talk about race, and try to step around
it, or not even talk about it in fear of what may happen (understanding),
but don;t shy away from it, nor this movie.  Rosewood was a small thriving
town in the middle of my home state of Florida.  Rosewood was entirely
black an Sumner was entirely white.  What happens is a lesson to us all
regarding suspicion, racial intolerance, segregation, silence (and the
culpability of silence in the face of horendous wrongdoing, on BOTH sides),
bigotry, and the ramifications of rape and race.

If you have 2 hours, and want to see something both painful and
enlightening, see this movie.  Then dicuss it with your friends.

Just my .02.

Oh an for all you west coast yahoos who think "Oh, that was the south, it
could and never did happen here", I would gently remind you of Rodney King,
the Lynching in Concord, the Asian brother shot in the head by Sonoma
County Police, and the list continues.  watch the movie, then talk to
friends...the long road to healing starts with us.

Peace,
John

From: Leslie Ayres <leslie@netcommunications.net>
Subject: RE: The scene... please read
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

guys, guys.....

as john lee so eloquently stated ... nothing changes the way you think it does.

i think we're talking about perception here... and, like john, i am
observing a much shorter cycle from "raving is my life and spiritual
salvation" to "what happened to the scene i loved?" ...

and the real problem is NOT the scene per se (though, yes, there are
cyclical changes in the scene) ... it is in YOUR OWN PERCEPTIONS.

for you youngsters on here, here's a big lesson... ready????

Relax!  There's plenty of time to do the things you want!!  You do not have
to immerse yourself in what you think raving is as if it is the secret to
life!

If you started raving in the last year/months/whatever ... and you already
feel burned out and disillusioned, then it's not about the scene, it's
about you.  What were your expectations?  Was there some void in your life
that you thought raving would fill?

Ask yourself if you dove headfirst into the world of mind-altering
substances (because that is a shortcut to burnout, my friends).

Ask yourself if you stopped doing the other things you used to like to do,
like read, go to movies, cook a meal with friends, take a daytime drive and
picnic on the beach, shop for comic books, whatever.

It's all about moderation and not expecting something to take the primary
meaning in your life.

While I do believe that what raving can show us can change your life (the
feeling of complete happiness that i found dancing in the wee hours of the
morning surrounded by beats and friends has changed me forever) ... it's
ain't the be-all and the end-all.

The party goes on ... with or without you...

Love, Leslie

peter sandifer wrote:

> spaz wrote:
> > Spiral Tribe soundsystem are back on the west coast.....come kick it
> > with
> > the tribe on friday night oct. 10 at a low key warehouse
> > session....all
> > ages ...$5
> >
> > 1-888-984-2075 for location

> Say, aren't these the kidz who got chased out of the UK
> way back in 1990 with the sheriff on their tail and have
> been roaming the earth in exile ever since?

They pretty much started the whole thing with Castlemorton<sp> which was
this massive 3 day thing that just got bigger as more people turned up,
and was far too large for the police to break up. In modern demo
parlance they achieved 'critical mass' and were surrounded rather than
split up.

After that they got some sort of recording deal, but caned the phones at
the record company organising parties, and left for europe. When I was
in Paris the other year, people thought that because I was English I
knew Spiral Tribe personally, because they had created the whole free
party scene there.

Reportedly they became excessively darkside on K in the later days in
England. I did see an inverview featuring one of them and Hakim Bey of
Temporary Autonomous fame, which was interesting because they have
created quite a few anarchistic autonomous zones (raves) in their time.

I've gota a couple of tracks by them, its good hard techno. They're
practically mythological figures here, in terms of coolness. There's
some songs by u4ia/f8 which are quite similar.

> Kewl.  I can't wait...

I'm envious.

Yours Nick

that it's relevant...


kid bippy- i didn't even go to play nice, so i have nothing to add 
here.  

ephedrine/mushrooms/ecstacy/whatever the hell drugs we were talking 
about:  I CHOOSE NOT TO RESPOND DUE TO THE FACT THAT E-MAIL IS NOT 
ENCRYPTED so anybody (big brother) is watching this right now.  

the scene- i went to my first rave a little over a year ago, and am
still in love with it.  i think i am thoroughly addicted to partying,
but am not seeking help.  :-)  it is my therapy.

and there is plenty of positive things going on here: we got 
boomerang's jokes for one....:-)

-doreen

Niels P. Mayer wrote:

> Please define the distinguishing features/characteristics of different
> "Jungle" styles, e.g., Techstep, Jump Up, Hardstep, and of course,
> Dookie Step, which is the sound of the jungle tune I was attempting 
> the other day :-)

TechStep is great! Sorta inbetween drum&bass and techno. It has a slower
more dancable breakbeat sorta <bosh> <ta> <bosh> <bosh> and low dark
acid basslines, sorta waaawwarrwwww waaawww. 

You could have a go at making this using a win95 machine, Orangator and
Fast Tracker II. Where these are on the net I'll leave as an exercise.
You can listen to badboiz by big daddy as an example, but this is mostly
sample loops.

Gain the Means of Production.

BTW, I know why Jungle is called Jungle! There was also some early Dub
called Drum and Bass.

Yours Nick

From: "Niels P. Mayer" <mayer@netcom.com>
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

> Don't say Windows *anything* to Niels. He gets cranky... ;-)

Now now, remember that I'm the newfangled kinder gentler Niels. So this
is not entirely true.

I currently use windows to run the following apps:
(1) Cakewalk Pro Audio 6.0 on Windows (and eventually Logic Audio).
(2) Mark of the Unicorn Control/Routing Panel for Midi Timepiece AV
(3) CoolEdit
(4) TurboTax
(5) MS Visual C++ (for work, tho I try to avoid it like the plague)
(6) MS Word, to view/print documents made by coworkers not sophisticated
	enough to use a real operating system and good typesetting software.

Otherwise, I prefer running the X Window System on Linux or SGI's Irix.

Hell, given my current job as explainer/recommender/debunker of new
technologies to  upper-management types at a very large electronic
commerce/transaction company, I am required to be nonpartisan and
extremely pragmatic on all issues. This means not dissing Windows
because it is a braindamaged, ass-backward, flawed attempt at software
engineering. I have to take market considerations into account, which
means it's perfectly ok to promote solutions that suck to a captive
audience of morons (customers) that wouldn't know a better solutions if
it bit them on the ass.

So, I have no problem doing/consulting/advising on issues related to
MFC, Visual C++, and I've even dropped my objection to Java now that
Sun finally wised up to the last 30-or-so years of Computer Language
Design and added "Inner Classes"; hell, they even got rid of AWT's
idiotic event model and made something that only partially sucks!

But yeah, if given the choice, I'd still be programming in Unix using
Smalltalk, Lisp, Scheme, or Winterp. And yeah, I continue to watch
people floundering on things that would take one engineer one week to
solve in Lisp and Unix but instead takes teams of 50 engineers years to
engineer, reengineer, debug, test, and rewrite a few times... using
such wonderful modern provenances like Windows, Visual C++, and MFC.
But hey, that's progress for ya.

 =-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
==>>                    Niels Mayer (mayer@netcom.com)                   <<==
 =-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=

computer technology, you can increase your Serionin levels on the
average of 21% just by listening to Alpha wavs, whish you can
synchronize into any sound on your computer.  I know it sounds kindof
complicated, but it is actually much easier to do than expected. 
(Note, listening to alpha wavs also increases your mental awareness,
memory retention, and also has an 11% increase in Norepinephrin
levels, and a 
25% increase in Beta-Endorphin levels.  Good stuff!)  This is all done
through a program called "Cool Edit", which you can get off of the
net.   I use alpha wavs for this purpose, and also to study.  I also
use Theta wavs, which make your brain think it is sleeping, and
induces a very deep state of meditation.  If anyone is intersted in
either the Theta or Alpha wavs, or increasing the amount of
neurotransmitters in their brain, please give me a shout back.

> split up.

> party scene there.

YES! My point exactly...when people talk about there being rat poison or
speed or who-knows-what on blotter,and how gels are more "pure" it really
makes me chuckle because the amount of lsd that trips you up is *so* small
that nothing else really can produce toxic effects in such small quantities!
 so blotter is actually pretty safe - it's either real or bunk, no in-between

My opinion of Kid Bippy's mixing skills, social skills, taste in
records to play and choice of who to have represent him aside...

Suffice to say, I survived his set with some moral support, and had the
honor of being the guy who had to tell off his manager at Play Nice
after telling ReAch to "get off the decks" without consulting anybody
first.

DJs are not celebrities and should not be treated as such.  They are
people who are lame/sick/visionary enough to fall in love with music and
push it on others in the hope that it might affect them the same way... 
Fortunately, for the time being, this is seen as a service to the
community... but not a service worth being disrespected for.


On the topic of _Our Scene_ recommended reading below:


     "The music did not stop.  On it went, and on, pounding and
unchanging...There was no dancing in couples any more.  Arms were
outstreched to embrace everyone within reach, and knees were bent and feet
pounded the earth to the slow beating...The dancers began in low humming,
one note struck deep in the throught, and in off beat.  A quarter-tone came
in.  More and more voices took up the beat and the quarter-tone.  Whole
sections of the packed dancing space were bobbing to the rhythm...The
dancers lost identity.  Faces grew rapt, shoulders fell slighlty forward,
each person became a part of the dancing body, and the soul of the body was
the rhythm.
     Joseph, with glowing eyes, stood apart.  His feet moved slightly with
the throbbing, and he felt tied to the dancing body, but he did not join in.
He thought exultantly: 'We have found something here, all of us.  In someway
we've come closer to the earth for a moment...Something will come of this.
It's a kind of powerful prayer."

John Steinbeck   circa 1933
"To A God Unknown"  

It's not ours, it's not new, but too many people have found it for it not
to be real...

BELIEVE in that moment, mouth agape, eyes closed, going into the space
between your ears and feeling the music as it should have been felt all
along.  Open your eyes to _the_ family, assembled in _the_ house, waves of
emotion pouring over you, and you and you... this list has nothing to do
with it, except that we all claim to be interested.  It doesn't mean we
all "get it" or that there's even one singular way to "get it".

Damn...

Fact is, that as much as we blab on this list about PLUR, it's okay for
some people to be flagrant jerks, while other's need merely wear the wrong
clothes or call a 1200 a "record player" or be the wrong color and get
labeled as homie Gs or just plain mean or not hip or 'Oakland types'
whatever... suffice to say they get dissed, labeled as outsiders, etc
without as much as a chance to say "hello". 

I honestly believe the biggest danger to the scene is those who claim to
be it's flagbearers, it's hardcorest, it's defenders of the faith.  This
is not a contest, this can be a sustainable way to enjoy life if you don't
burn yourself out, if you don't kill your body and mind by poisoning
yourself in an effort to treat recreational drugs as an Olympic event, if
you think and feel, if you never forget it's for everybody and it was here
before you came. 

Careful with your labels and who you defend, many of you stand to look
mighty stupid in retrospect.  All the glitter, E, and huggles in the world
won't keep the world from making it's own judgements of you in a similar
fashion someday.

Life is not a rave.

Peace,
AndyW

---"glittergirl@value.net" <glittergirl@value.net> wrote:
>
> >At 11:17 PM 10/7/97 EDT, foolish_fish1@juno.com wrote:
> >>
> >>St johns wort, a herb used for centuries to treat depression might
> >>also be used to counteract the negative effects E
> 
> Okay, I haven't done any research on this in a while, so I might get
some
> facts wrong:  Prozac can be taken with E (or while you are coming
down from
> it) because it is only an SSRI (Selective Seratonin Reuptake
Inhibitor);
> however, most anti-depressants (including St. John's Wort) are MAOIs
> (MonoAmine Oxidase Inhibitor).  E also acts like an MAOI in many
ways and
> when you combine E and an MAOI, it can have quite harsh effects.  I
don't
> remember exactly what those effects are -- I just wanted to warn
people to
> do some serious reserach before trying to take St. John's Wort while
on E
> or coming down from it.

you're right about the maoi's... it can be extremely dangerous to
combine them. (their effect is that they normalize the amount of amine
in the brain - which has nothing to do with the effects of ecstacy).
tricyclics may or may not be safe - the way they work is not really
known - they are thought to affect the serotonin or norepinephrine
levels in the brain. also beware of mixing cold medecines with
maoi's.... i'm not sure if st. john's wort is an maoi or a tricyclic,
but just because it's an herb doesn't mean that it can do no harm.
there are quite a few ssri's on the market now; i'm not recalling all
of the names at this point tho. but as i said earlier, these drugs
seriously alter your brain chemistry - they were designed for ppl who
lack certain chemicals and not for ppl who take so much e that they
become depressed. hey. you take a drug, deal with it's after effects.
take responsibility for your actions. it'll pass! be glad you don't
have that mood as a permanent fixture in your life.  

e. :)

if you are going to mix, i'm sure there's an abundance of info on the
web about all this shit.

On Thu, 9 Oct 1997, lara at vibe.org wrote:

> Hey all of you: in memory of a close family friend that passed away
> recently, I came across a poem he sent me in the mail quite randomly.. And
> as the years have passed, this poem has become my creed of friendship... I
> want to share it to you all. It's by Ruth Senter.
> 
> If I really cared...
> I'd look you in the eyes when you talked to me.
> I'd think about what you were saying
> Rather than what I'm going to say next.
> I'd hear your feelings
> As well as your words.
> 
> If I really cared...
> I'd listen without defending.
> I'd hear without deciding wheter you were right or wrong.
> I'd ask you where I've blown it and where I've made it.
> 
> If I really cared...
> I'd laugh WITH you but not at you.
> I'd talk WITH you and not to you.
> And I'd know when it's time to do neither.
> 
> If I really cared...
> I wouldn't climb over your walls. 
> I'd hang around until you let me in the gate.
> I wouldn't unlock your secrets;
> I'd wait until you handed me the key.
> 
> If I really cared...
> I'd love you anyhow
> But I'd ask you for the best you can give me
> And gently draw it from you.
> 
> If I really cared...
> I'd put my scripts away
> And leave my solutions at home. 
> The performances would end
> And we would be ourselves..
> 
> --Ruth Senter
> 
> Think about this one.
> 
>

Helloooooo all you boys and girls.....  : o )
With all this incredibly amazing long awaited rain, great ideas have been
forming in this People Loving United Ravers'  (Head?)....  = )
I have been discussing with a few folks,  the idea of having a gathering at
my house in san francisco, for all you lovely kids out there so that we can
meet each other, and have fun, and watch a few movies (remember the care
bears?)  -and anything else one might want to watch if they weren't all too
into the care bears...  
I think it would be nice to have you all over,chill one night, talk, watch
movies, share our fave music, meet fellow sfravers... etcera.... so, if
anybody is into it, write me a note, and i can get an idea of how many of you
folks want to gather here.  Maybe you could all bring something to drink, or
snack on, or contribute to the evening (tunes, movie, sweets,you get the
idea...)
I live in a pretty large flat right on Haight street, almost right above
Housewares.  And i promise the POleece wont break it apart...  = )   ~(if we
keep it happy)~

So let me know how you guys feel- and we'll set a date! 


Passin' the Lovin'
~Maya~

From: "John S. Lee" <jsl@nexsys.net>

Cc: Amandust3@aol.com, SFRaves@hyperreal.org

Precedence: bulk

Hey Lara, good post, although I wanted to add a few thangs...

At 12:30 AM -0400 10/9/97, lara at vibe.org wrote:
<snip>

>taht it is NOT just our perceptions that has changed, it has been alot of
>people -- not the entire scene, but maybe our group of friends.

The only thing for certain is change.

>	But I also agree that my perception has changed alot. I'd rather
>go to Halloween Tribal MAssive to hear DJ RAP and Stretch and Coldcut and
>Sneak and etc. etc. than go to Happy Kids and hear UG Dj's. And I'm
>supposed to be HELPING (and still will be) with Happy Kids. I've went back
>to when I first got into the scene -- the reason I go to parties is the
>music once again. I went to parties in search of finding the UG Jungle
>scene and ended up being sucked into the September child "I love you,
>everything's so beautiful" phase instead. I admit I made partying a large
>part of my life and threw alot of things away that I've been currently
>gathering back up and enjoying. But alot of us have done that. That's what
>give sthe scene the PLUR'ry attitude, yanno? Without the people who make
>partying a huge part of their life, you would NOT have bombass parties
>going on all the time. I know that alot of you promoters who throw parties
>have lives other than parties, but is it not true the the party pretty
>much becomes your life at a certian point right before the party? You
>can't do that if you're jaded or whatever.

Sure you can.  I'm jaded as hell, but still have a great time when I go
out.  Fact remains however that I understand the various aspects of parties
(raves), done them for a number of years, and am now happy to go to the
occasional party, ahve a good time, and come home to my real life.  Since
the afterparty scene has fizzled out as compared to it's heydey, it's
enough that I have my own kind of afterparty with somem friends or my loved
one, chilling out.  The fun is what you make it.  You're 100% responsible
for your own vibe.

>	Things come and go, people change, I change, you change. The scene
>changes. I realized that I've met more SKETCHY and FAKE people in the
>scene than OUTSIDE of my scene that I've met in my whole life. But I can
>also say I've metthe most BEAUTIFUL people I've known ever in the scene
>(other than my mother and sister, who are truly the best). But alot of
>people come into the scene, see the PLUR and assume that everyone in the
>scene is overwhelmingly trustworthy -- that ravers are BETTER human
>beings. But in reality, ravers ARE human beings.

I've always had a problem with that acronym (PLUR), and it seems as time
goes on I hear it less and less, another transitory phrase of rave I guess.
In any instance, I do think that what has happened is that the scene was
built up by perhaps you and your pals as something other than what it was,
or what it always ahs been; just a party.  Now I know there are several
groups that are trying to get past this, but to me it essentiallly remains
the same with all the trappings that any entertainment has to offer.  The
thing about rave is when you start out you're alone, when things are just
about over for you you may find yourself not so alone and with 1 or more
solid friends from the experience.  At worse, you've had one helluva time.

I call that a win win.

>	SO here's to summarize what I tried to point out, and then some:
>
>1) Amanda is right, things are changing, but...
>2) They're changing in our group of friends, and not necessarily in the
>entire scene... but...
>3) things ARE changing in the scene, everything IS constantly changing,
>both for the better and for the worse... Hence
>4) For Amanda and I, the scene sucks right now because hat *we percieve*
>as the scene has really let us down... because
>5) We've both changed ourselves... and the rose colored glasses are off,
>so..
>6) We see alot of realities that have been hidden before because we failed
>to look for the fact that:
>
>	- ravers are human, and thus act as humans accordingly so (be they
>	kind, mean, selfish, loving, careless, caring, responsible, reckless)
>	- the scene is not a good place to hide from real life -- nowhere
>	is
>	- raving is NOT a way of life (you kids can disagree, but there
>	ARE other pleasures in life)

Agreed, although for the ones who do this for a living, raves are an
integral part of their lives.

>	- PLUR doesn't really exist all that much

No acronym does, but you can take some components of that word and
integrate it into other aspects of your life.  I like respect, since from
that word the rest naturally follows.


>7) I want to add that Amanda's been partying for even longer than me, so
>to say she became jaded way before alot of you all is not true. If anyone,
>I'm the one who became jaded at a previous time...
>8) Being jaded makes you realize who your true friends are... which is a
>good thing to know.

Being jaded usually puts things into a perspective that justfies your
actions inactions.  It doesn;t necessarily reveal anything other than your
own truth which was there all along.

>9) Drugs can steal your soul, perception of reality, and watching alot of
>your friends, and in some cases yourself, lose themselves in a false
>world, really fucking makes you want to sober up.

Megan has gone over this one, and I agree with her (That's JSL's Megan that
is.)

>10) Not everyone loses their shit on drugs, PLUR, DRAMA, all that shit.
>11) Hence there are still good people in this world

Yes!

>12) Nobody's perfect, especially in the scene, and we can't expect anyone
>to be even close to perfect.
>13) AndyW you're totally right: DJS are NOT gods (but i knew this before)
>14) If you're a manager, don't be drunk on the job..
>15) Life is wonderful, Life is shit.
>depends on what kind of day you're having.

Life is a good thing, the conditions which it exists may not be ideal, but
life itself to me is a good thing.

>
>:)
>ok babes, flame away.

Who me?,
John

>>For Immediate Industry Release
>>Oct/97
>>
>>Styles Collide!
>>Streetsound and Push Records Team Up to Bring You the
>>Hall & Oates Remix Contest '97
>>
>>New York - Streetsound Magazine and Push Records are proud to present the
>>Hall & Oates Remix Contest '97, representing two of the most prolific pop
>>music producers working today. To mark the release of Marigold Sky and to
>>recognize the explosion of underground music and culture in the '90s, Daryl
>>Hall and John Oates, platinum masters of the pop airwaves, have personally
>>selected one of their new album tracks for unrestricted DJ remix treatment
>>in any underground style.
>>
>>What We Want
>>We're looking for a wide variety of original remix interpretations of a
>>newly-released Hall & Oates song. Remix styles may include house/club, hip
>>hop/rap, techno/electronica, reggae/dancehall, freestyle,
>>jungle/drum'n'bass, industrial/alternative, bhangra, Euro/NRG or any other
>>rhythm-based, dance-oriented sound.
>>
>>What You Win
>>If our panel of music industry experts selects you as one of the three
>>winners, you'll receive $500 US and Push will release your mix on
>>special-edition 12" vinyl along with remixes by Tommy Musto. We'll also
>>include you in all the publicity surrounding the project.
>>
>>How to Enter
>>Head over to the streetsound website at www.streetsound.com/hallandoates
>>and fill in the online registration form (you can also fax us at
>>212.337.1414 or email hallandoates@streetsound.com to request an entry
>>form). We'll pick 25 contestants and three ultimate winners. Pro
>>DJ/remixers and absolute beginners are equally welcome. The deadline for
>>entries is Oct. 31st, so be sure and enter now. Full details are included
>>on the entry form.
>>
>>Push Records is a BMG-distributed label founded by Brian Doyle and Rick
>>Flynn.
>>
>>Streetsound is North America's leading authority on DJ culture, publisher
>>of Streetsound Magazine and Streetsound Online.
>>
>>For More Information:
>>Streetsound Chris Torella: 212.337.1417
>>Push Records Glenn Orenstein: 212.486.7707
>>

The Darwin Awards
_________________

Jason Hunt originally brought the Darwin Award to our attention after
I had given a lecture claiming that many human behaviours are
established over the history of our species and our cultures, not just
the history of the individual.  Skinner's point on this issue was that
behaviours are selected by their consequences in the same fashion as
any other traits are "stamped in" and "stamped out" through natural
selection.

And as Jay pointed out, if useless or foolish physical features are
elimated from the gene pool as some individuals die off, then it makes
sense that some of the stupid human *behaviours* can become less
frequent as the useless and foolish individuals "remove themselves"
from any hope of breeding.

This year's Darwin Award winning story is a little more, um, tasteless,
compared to last year's story about the guy who rocketed his car into a
cliff. It's yucky, but it's true.
***********************************************************************
Newest Darwin Award Winners!!

As you may already know, THE DARWIN AWARDS are bestowed every year
upon (the remains of) that individual, who through single-minded self-
sacrifice, has done the most to remove undesirable elements from the
human gene pool. Last year's winner was the fellow who was killed when
he attached a JATO (Jet Assisted Take Off) unit to his Chevy Impala and
promptly shot himself at 300 mph into the side of a desert cliff.

And now, for this year's illustrious winner(s): . . .

John Pernicky and friend Sal Hawkins, of the great state of Washington,
decided to attend a local Metallica concert at the Amphitheater; the
Gorge at George, Washington. Having no tickets (but 18 beers between
them) they sat in the parking lot, and after finishing the beer,
decided that it would be easy enough to hop over the nine-foot high
fence and sneak into the show.

The two friends pulled their pickup truck over to the fence and the
plan was for John -- 100 pounds heavier than Sal -- to hop over, and
then assist his friend over the fence. Unfortunately for John, there
was a 30 foot drop on the other side of the fence. Having heaved
himself over, he found himself crashing through a tree. His fall was
abruptly halted by a large branch which snagged him by his shorts.

Dangling from the tree, with one arm broken, John looked down and saw
a group of bushes below him. Figuring the bushes would break his fall,
John removed his pocket knife and proceeded to cut away his shorts to
free himself from the tree. When finally free, John crashed below into
Holly bushes. The sharp leaves scratched his entire body and now being
without his shorts, he was the unwilling victim of a holly branch
penetrating his rectal cavity. To make matters worse, his pocket knife
proceeded to fall with him and landed three inches into his left thigh.

Seeing his friend in considerable pain and agony, Sal decided to throw
him a rope and pull him to safety. However, weighing about 100 pounds
less, he decided the best course of action would be to tie the rope to
the pickup truck. This is when things went from bad to worse.

In his drunken state, Sal put the truck into the wrong gear, pressed
on the gas, and crashed through the fence, landing on and killing his
friend. Sal was thrown from the truck, suffered massive internal
injuries and also died at the scene.

Police arrived to find a pickup truck with its driver thrown 100 feet
from the vehicle and upon moving the truck, a half naked man, with
numerous scratches, a holly stick up his rectum, a knife in his thigh,
and a pair of shorts dangling from the tree branches 25 feet in the
air.


Layne

Future Primitive Soundsession is a must if you are into any kind of real
beat hapnin' and or true propper talent.  It's not a new thing, FPSS comes
off hard as a one off, rotating the party from venue to venue with no set
schedule.  FPSS has even kicked off a indi label of the same name, the first
press is  Cut Chemist vs. Shortkut.  Anyone who saw that set live knows how
intense it was, and the crowd was even recorded live through the needle on
the deck.  KUSF has given it good airplay lately.  FPSS will blow your mind,
cut chemist is the masta (check the article on him by DJ Anna in the new
issue of sweater magazine), DJ's quest/disk/peanut butter
wolf/charloette/anna/felix the dog = propper local talent.  Below, the specs
are listed.

check it out.

dmarie

well, i decided to post to the thread.

my suggested drug for you all is honey.  for those of you who don't know
it, honey is "god-approved speed".  

a tablespoon of honey will keep your ass shakin' like a triple shot mocha.

further experimentation shows... the ever famous "Honey Bear" bottles
[available at your local grocery store] provides an excellent dispenser for
said honey [and it's *refillable*].

just think of all the energy in bees.  they transfer that shite right into
the honey [not necessarily a fact... but it's how i like to look at it]..
further more, have you ever seen bees in the hive?  they come in, and tell
the rest where the pollen is... by dancing.  shakin' their rump... the rest
of them just check him out, and head on off for the party.

Foolish Fish, 

why did you see Megan's comment as an attack on men (or you?)?  She never
implied anything about "intellectual inferiority".

I will never understand what it is like to be a woman, or black, or latino,
etc., as I was born a white male, and grew up with all its advantages.  That
does not preclude me, or others like me, from learning about the oppression
of other groups in our society, such that we don't add to that oppression.

And why is it that the only comment you have is that you feel insulted.
What do you think about the rest of the content in this thread? 

Kerry

Gawd,

I hate the oversimplification of MLK and Ghandi.  I tell you this much for
all that non-violent demonstration:  MLK was turning the corner and began
to think, right before he was assainated, that non-violence is only part of
the solution and it may become necessary at some time to revert to more,
active means of protest (read violence).

Also Ghandi had serious problems with the place of women in society, and
did little about the plight of females in his country.

These men were not gods, they were just people whos time and ideas had
come.  They were not above the predjudices, and the mores of thier times.

Oopsie!  It looks like a lot of people misunderstood my post.  Hey ladies...
I am a girl, I am totally down for equal rights.  I think that when people
have those views (seriously have those views) they are way out of line and
ignorant.  I was just pointing out that it was a joke.  I don't think that he
meant anything by it, so I'm not offended.  If I thought that he was
seriously trying to be sexist by posting that, then I would be offended!  I
am just as into fem-rights as the next girl BUT, I'm not a fem-nazi.  I
completely agree... fem jokes are just as out of line as racist joke but
there was no harm meant so I'll let it go.  I was just stating my opinion,
that is how I handle things.  You can only fight so many fights in life, make
the fights you choose worth while.  Do you think that any race would get
anywhere if they fought everyone for every little racist joke that was told.
 No, they fight the big fights and let the little ones go.  
     Hey, I am not trying to offend anyone. I just didn't see the joke as
that big of a deal.  If anyone disagrees that is completely fine!  We are all
our own person and we all have our own opinions.  Something that offends one
person might not offend the next.  Our diversity is what I love about us!
 Disagreeing is alright, its fighting that stinks!  I love you all
(equally!!!)  Until next time!

                             Hugs and Sloppy Kisses to you all!!!-
                                   ~*~ the Glitter Princess ~*~

At 11:10 PM -0400 10/12/97, GlttrPrncs@aol.com wrote:
>Oopsie!  It looks like a lot of people misunderstood my post.  Hey ladies...
>I am a girl, I am totally down for equal rights.  I think that when people
>have those views (seriously have those views) they are way out of line and
>ignorant.  I was just pointing out that it was a joke.  I don't think that he
>meant anything by it, so I'm not offended.  If I thought that he was
>seriously trying to be sexist by posting that, then I would be offended!  I
>am just as into fem-rights as the next girl BUT, I'm not a fem-nazi.

What the hell is a fem-nazi?  I know that bubbling, bungling idiot Rush
Limbaugh used that term to label anyone who beleived in women's rights as
such.  Don;t let big media, and big fatheads like Limbaugh invade your
wordspace.  fem-nazi label is rubbish.


>  I
>completely agree... fem jokes are just as out of line as racist joke but
>there was no harm meant so I'll let it go.

and where does it stop?  When do you stop and say enough is enough.  I for
one do not tell jokes about people's sex, race, creed, etc.  I hated the
round of "dumb blonde" jokes etc.  Basically I don't tell jokes since they
are always at the cost of someone else.

(NOTE:  I know some of you will ask the question, "How come it is okay for
blacks to call each other the "N" word, homosexuals can call thier own
"f*gs", etc.  well Chris Rock said it best "The reason is the same reason
that you can call your child dummy, but it is not ok for someone else to do
it."  Simple.)

There is one thing for a woman to tell a joke about women, men about men,
balcks about blacks, etc.  and to me that is fine.  But the second you
start crossing lines I find it patently offensive and wrong (I for one ,
when I had calbe would watch in amazement and disgust as some Def Jam
Comedy hour made fun of whites ad nauseum...).

So until we progress as a species, I think jokes should be told only by
those qualified to do so (see above and think of Chris Rock's words).

>I was just stating my opinion,
>that is how I handle things.  You can only fight so many fights in life, make
>the fights you choose worth while.

A matter of choice, but I would also say as a Jew and African American,
silence = death.


>Do you think that any race would get
>anywhere if they fought everyone for every little racist joke that was told.

Yes we have gotten somehwere becuase these jokes are now considered in bad
taste if told by anyone other than a black person.  It is due to the
struggles of black people that the society at large will cringe when racism
is at it's most overt.  So yes, I do think that becuase we have become
sensitized to race issue sthat we have gone far in our realtions with each
other.  And yet, there is so much more to do.

> No, they fight the big fights and let the little ones go.

wrong.  You fight the fights that need fighting.  Some will be little, like
sitting in the front of the bus, others will be large, like boycotting the
entire bus system.

>     Hey, I am not trying to offend anyone. I just didn't see the joke as
>that big of a deal.

and others did.  So i think that would give anyone pause to reflect.
Something I *had* to come to grips with was my own sexism.  For instance,
there wasd this raging fight going on SFR between two guys.  I sent out a
post that said something to the effect "Are you girls done?".  Leslie Ayers
called me on it, and I was silent about it for a *long* time.  I had to
come correct after some deep reflection and made a general apology to the
list.  Yes, it was something I considered a joke, and to me it was small.
But Les called me on it and I had to reflect, and talk to others about what
I said.  Although it took time I started to see the other side and had to
admit that it was a sexist thing to say. I think I have become a btter
person for it.  All from one little thing.

>If anyone disagrees that is completely fine!  We are all
>our own person and we all have our own opinions.  Something that offends one
>person might not offend the next.  Our diversity is what I love about us!
> Disagreeing is alright, its fighting that stinks!

You often cannot have both for the same price.

>  I love you all
>(equally!!!)  Until next time!
>
>                             Hugs and Sloppy Kisses to you all!!!-
>                                   ~*~ the Glitter Princess ~*~
>

Peace out,
John

"The first casualty of war is truth." - Rudyard Kipling

attendee of the regular Wednesday night Slow Roasted at City Espresso. 
(Those who go probably see me there sometimes...)

And happy happy... I just got a new car. Well, not really new, but it's 
new to me. I'm trying to decide what to name it. It's an '83 blue 
Mustang, so any of you who know me and have a creative name, please drop 
me an email at merstefi@hotmail.com. 

And hey, drop me an email anyhow... I miss you guys! I haven't been to a 
party since True Love! (not counting that little pop-by at Sunset at the 
Berkeley Marina.) Mostly that's because I got a job at Whole Foods on 
Stevens Creek... It's nice to have money coming in again. And for those 
wondering, me and Cracked-Out Elmo Matt are still maintaining our crazy 
relationship.

Ta ta for now. It's good to be home again.

Luv 'n' Lucky Charms

thinking about next friday night, the 17th.  If there are too many wonderful
things happening that night, let me know and we will reschedule.  But i
looked at the calendar, and it seems to be mostly weeklies lately anyways.
 No UG's are on the horizon are they?

complaints on the date, why dont we say 8:30 or 9pm? 
My address is #1338 (no apt #)  , it is above the Emerald Triangle (a head
shop), and it is painted reddish / yellowish, and beween Masonic and Central.

coming in from out of town and doesn't want to drive back that nite, you can
crash at my house.

(to sit on), yerself, etc... you get the idea-  to bring together the group,
and to get a good vibe going again... We need that sometimes, and there
hasn't been enough of it lately.  We all seem pretty scattered...  It's all

Well, all you happy (and sometimes not so happy) raver children.... I got
 many wonderful little responses to my movie/get to know each other nite
post, and i am really looking forward to meeting all you guys that can come.
 It will be good to meet the faces behind the letters, and clear the air a
little...  : ) right?
Anyways, it looks like about 15-18 people responded, and that will be good.
 If anyone wants to bring along some friends or anything, you can too.  I was
thinking about next friday night, the 17th.  If there are too many wonderful 
things happening that night, let me know and we will reschedule.  But i 
looked at the calendar, and it seems to be mostly weeklies lately anyways.
 No UG's are on the horizon are they?
Like i said, i live on Haight street in SF, and if there aren't any 
complaints on the date, why dont we say 8:30 or 9pm? 
My address is #1338 (no apt #)  , it is above the Emerald Triangle (a head 
shop), and it is painted reddish / yellowish, and beween Masonic and Central.
     
If anybody needs directions coming into SF, or to get to Haight street let me 
know.  I am working on saturday, but not till late, so if there is someone 
coming in from out of town and doesn't want to drive back that nite, you can 
crash at my house.
Just bring whatever you want to share, music, movies, drinks, food, pillows 
(to sit on), yerself, etc... you get the idea-  to bring together the group, 
and to get a good vibe going again... We need that sometimes, and there 
hasn't been enough of it lately.  We all seem pretty scattered...  It's all 
El Ninos fault!!!   =  )~ .........
anyways, i hope to see you all there...: )
     
     
~~~Keep the Love Alive~~~
~I'll try to... Maya~

     hi all
     I believe it's a good idea. A few days ago, i ask the people to sent 
     me some pics from the raves., but there was only one response.
     i like to create a section on my webpage (www.mehlem.com) for the 
     united ravers all over the world (s.f., munich, helsinki and what 
     else), with a focus on the bay area (my favourite place, and the 
     people i love). with txt.files, picz, soundz and actuall events.
     
     At my Webpage i have 5 MB space. I like to use for pictures a wavelet 
     compression. That makes the picz much smaller. I can use this page 
     commercial. So we can put some commercials on it, when we need (to get 
     money for a printed non-profit magazine). 
     
     I have a Digital Camera to take picz (i take a lot of picz from the 
     summer of love, i put them today on my webpage).
     
     And at last, i work as a Graphics Design Engineer, so i have all tools 
     (and i use them): photoshop, 3dmax, pagemaker, illustrator, macromedia 
     director and flash. I have also experiences in webdesign and 
     development (based on real projects).
     
     I hope we can start now :-)
     
     
     with all my love
     h.p.m. - l.i.s.
     www.mehlem.com

Niels P. Mayer wrote:

> This appears to be the follow-on to the MC-303, it'll become available
> sometime next year. There's a picture of it on
> http://www.teknet.ch/tb303.htm (drool).

I've never owned an mc-303 myself, but they seemed to appear in the
'drum machines' section in the music magazines for sale a couple of
months after they came out. I gathered that they weighed more heavily on
the 'sample' rather than 'synthesis' based music production. 

I can certainly one when I hear one, they sound more metallic and guitar
like, I think.

If I bought such in hardware, I would buy a 308, which is manufactured
in germany, or get a soft synth like an rb-338 which seem to be *much*
more fun. I personally prefer my rubber duck, some vaz, and an
orangator!

Yours Nick
