Now this is very strange. Not one, but two amazing CDs are mentioned here
and both have some kind of other versions that have similar sounding titles
but are definitely not as good.

"LTJ Bukem presents Logical Progression" is the actual title of one of the
most amazing CDs on the planet. It's a double CD with a picture of the Earth
on the cover. I assume this is the one you're talking about, byroni.

Now, I recommended this one to a friend of mine (not giving her the exact
title) and she ended up buying some other LTJ Bukem Logical Progression,
which was only one CD and wasn't nearly as good.

So be careful with this one too.

Adam

there are actually 2 volumes of logical progression.  vol 1 is the 2 CD
set with the 1/4 shot of planet earth (?) on the cover.  vol 2 is newer
(duh), and I've never heard it.

bukem also has a series called 'earth'...I believe it's an import
only...and I think there are at least 2 vols as well.  earth flat out is
beautiful, and I've heard that vol.2 is good as well.

-jimg

I've *never* heard anything produced/remixed/created by LTJ that I didn't
love. This guy is a musical genius and I feel we're on the same plain, in
terms of the state of consiousness we strive for. The music is so
beautiful... filled with such emotion.... sigh. Nice. Earth2 (LTJ BUKEM
PRESENTS EARTH 2) is nice... but is more hip-hoppy.. but is just as
enjoyable....

Byroni
(The boy who wants every GoodLooking/LookingGood/Cookin/Earth record in
existence...)

From: "peter sandifer" <boomerangflip@hotmail.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: A.D.A.T. qvestion NRR
Content-Type: text/plain
Date: Thu, 30 Oct 1997 13:46:07 PST
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

okay, heres the sitch.

I have an analogue master of my mixtape.  I'm recording that master 
using my sony tape deck, onto an ADAT tape, so I can have a digital 
master.

The analogue master is clean, but for some reason when I record onto
the adat tape,  I keep getting these nasty clicks.  It's like  the ADAT 
machine is putting the clicks onto the recording.  When I play the ADAT 
recording back, the clicks are still on it.  But if I stop and record it 
again, the clicks are in different places.  The same thing happens using 
different ADAT tapes.

anyone know how to fix this?

>I'm trying to get some information on temporary bar code tattoos
>that ravers are wearing in Japan (and elsewhere?) I heard that
>the tattoos come in packs of five, and have encrypted messages in them.
>The messages are they read by small scanners that club kids carry around.
>Does anyone know anything about this? Is this actually a trend coming
>our way? Any information you can send me would be much appreciated.
>
    Don't know about Japan, but I was drawing them on my ankle all the time
when I lived in Central California.  It's easy.  All you do is get a Magic
Marker and a ruler.  Then make a bar code by using various angles with the
Magic Marker for that thin/thick bar effect.  Looks hella cool even close
up.  The numbers are a little bit trickier and for that you'll probably need
a sharpie and a friend.

    ******************** My roommate is a mean girl
*****************************

    Nico

With Halloween on a Friday this year, there are lots o' parties going on,
starting tonight with a Halloween edition of Pure Space, and Harvest Moon
and Direction.  On Halloween itself, Funky Tekno Tribe has maybe its
biggest lineup ever, then there are other parties in the city, and in Reno,
Sacramento, Chico, and down South; and your friends are probably having 
parties too.  Expect everyone to regroup at Stompy on Saturday, then I
like some of the other smaller parties during the week next week.



                                THE SFR CALENDAR
                                       
    http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar/gencal.cgi
   
     _________________________________________________________________
   
Upcoming Parties in the San Francisco Bay Area

   Thursday, October 30th - _Pure Space_
   the Halloween Trip or Freak
   Garth, Spun, Galen, Solar, Darkhorse, Felix.
   Lightshows by Donovan & FU-KUU Hi-Fi.

Info Lines

     * Be-At Info Line - 415-626-4087. Usually has 5-10 listings, updated
       daily.
     * the Buzz-line, a global party network - 415.568.1338
     * Clubline - 415.979.8686
     * Frequency 8 Trance/Techno infoline - 415.541.5019
     * The Groove Line - (415) 331.1500 ext.4788
     * Housewares Rave Line - 415.281.0125
       
   
     _________________________________________________________________
   
Radio/TV Shows

     * Sunday night 8pm-10pm - "Soundz of Resistance" w/DJ Poohbear.
       Underground electronic music, mainly jungle/drum and bass, dub and
       hard techno along with guest DJs, interviews and not-so-random
       amples of life. KZSC 88.1 (Santa Cruz)
     * Sunday night 11pm-2am - "The Dreaming/Innermind Show" w/DJ Miracle
       & Mr. Monchichi. House, Jungle, Trip-Hop, Ambient, Dub,
       Break-Beats & guest DJs. KSCU 103.3 (Santa Clara)
     * Sunday night midnight-1am - "Shortwave" - Electronic music in all
       of its guises. KALX, 90.7 FM (Berkeley)
     * Tuesday night 9pm-mid - "An Epiphany of Sound" hosted by J.C. The
       best in beats to satiate your inner child. Electronic dance,
       noise, spoken word, world music and more. Also available in
       RealAudio. KZSU 90.1 (Stanford)
     * Wednesday night 9pm-11pm - free form music mix. KPFA 94.1
       (Berkeley)
     * Wednesday night/Thursday morning - "the tube" hosted by miss laura
       aka lola. an electronic excursion into ambient soundscapes,
       ethereal trance, and washes of other whimsical muzik. KAZU 90.3
       (Monterey Bay Community Radio)
     * Thursday morning 10am-2pm - "The Further Adventures of Aardvark" -
       trip-hop to experimental to ambient to gabba etc, etc. KSJS 90.5
       (San Jose).
     * Thursday 5pm-9pm - The Beta Lounge - Live netcast of jungle, dub,
       breakbeat, hiphop, ambient, experimental.
       http://www.betalounge.com/
     * Friday 9:30am-noon - Snappy the Aligator plays deep groove music
       that dips into cool electronic sounds, classic soul, reggae &
       more. KALX, 90.7 FM (Berkeley)
     * Friday 3pm-6pm - free form music mix. KUSF 90.3 (SF) (also
       available on Realaudio
     * Fridays 9pm-midnight - Andrew from Groove Merchant spins on KUSF
       90.3 (SF)
     * Friday night/Saturday morning - midnight-noon. House/techno mix
       with Johnny K, Ozone & guests - KCSS 91.9 Central Valley (Turlock)
     * Friday night/Saturday morning - "Just Desserts" w/Mr.Goodwrench -
       10pm-2am Jungle, Detroit, Techno, Acid House, whacked-out Dub, and
       noise KFJC 89.7 - Los Altos Hills
     * Friday night - Moondance. Ambient; 3am-7:30am, KUSF 90.3 SF.
     * Saturday afternoon - "Bus Stop" - music and talk w/guest DJs from
       SF and beyond. 2pm-3pm. KUSF 90.3 SF.
     * Saturday night 9pm-mid - "Underbrush" w/DJ Radon and guests -
       Beats, Breakz and Buzz KZSU 90.1 (Stanford). Also broadcast via
       RealAudio.
     * Saturday night 11pm - Flux Television, Viacom Channel 53 -
       Ambient, acid jazz and house music videos & interviews. (415)
       281-3377. flux@flux.net
     * (every other) Saturday night 10p-12:30a - "1984" w/DJ Richtoffen.
       House, Trance and German rave. 90.1 (Chico)
     * Saturday night - "amp" 1am. MTV.
     * Saturday night - "Subsonic". 1am-6am, KITS 105.3 SF.
     * Saturday night - "House Nation" w/"Anthems Mix", Top 10s from
       guest DJs and "London Connection w/DJ Doubt". 2am-4am, WILD 94.9
       SF.
     * Ambiance Magazine - 9:30p weds-sun PNC Cable 2 (Modesto &
       Oakdale), 9p fri & sat, marcus cable ch 9 (ceres & turlock).

Administrative Notes

   If anyone has info on any other events, send it to me! I can't
   possibly hope to get all the info every week.
   
   This info gets sent via email every Thursday. To subscribe or
   unsubscribe to the calendar mailing list, send e-mail to
   majordomo@hyperreal.org with either the line
   
   subscribe sfraves-calendar or
   unsubscribe sfraves-calendar
   
   There is also an sfraves discussion mailing list for issues related to
   clubs, parties, house and techno music, etc. To subscribe, send e-mail
   to majordomo@hyperreal.org with the line
   
   subscribe sfraves
   
   in the body of the message.
   
   
   
   
    Derek Chung - dhchung@hyperreal.org

i don't know if i even need soundz for the beats ne more; i think i have
waayyy to many beats in my head--like a couple of days ago i went out to my
car to get something and i'm like 'groovinnnn' dancing back and forth and

YES YES YES!!!  It's my favorite holiday of the whole year!!!  Hallowe'en 
rocks!!!

I mean, think about it.  It's really the most no-bullshit holiday there 
is.  All you need to do is have a pumpkin, dress funky and give out 
candy.  It's much like raving (except ravers don't often carry around 
pumpkins...).  There's no hassle about some sweat that Aunt Helena made 
that doesn't fit right and relatives don't come in from out of town and 
mess up your house and there's no undercooked turkey to worry about or 
anything like that!  All you have to do is have fun and then you get to 
give out candy to all sorts of little kids in constumes!  

So I'm very very very happy that it's Halloween again!!!!

I hope everyone has a good time at whatever event they go to!  I'm 
spinning at a fun outdoor thing here in Orange County, so I'll even get 
to boogie with ravers! :D

I'll see you all soon!!  Don't eat too much candy!! :)

-UncleNoah

                                       ABANDON
                                       STUDIOS

          BUILT BY A BAND, FOR BANDS. Our goal
          was  to  create a versatile  project
          studio  where  we  could  have   the
          luxury  of digital recording in  the
          comfort of a psychedelic lounge.  We
          use it to capture our improvisations
          and  edit  them into clean  finished
          pop  songs. Lights dimmed,  candles,
          jamming  pure sound till the morning
          comes.  We had such a good  time  in
          our studio we decided to open it  up
          to public.

A  BIG  BLANK CANVAS. With our  system
you   capture  your  imagination  onto
inexpensive  ADAT tapes  ($12/60  min.
compared  to $75/15 min. of 1" analog
tape).  Cheap tape means never  having
to  record  over a take and plenty  of
room to experiment.

                    LOOK  MA, NO MISTAKES. Much of the polish
                    of professional tracks comes from careful
                    excising  of mistakes and compositing  of
                    multiple  takes through digital  editing.
                    After   tracking,  you  can   edit   your
                    material into perfection or rearrange  it
                    entirely. Non-destructive, random  access
                    editing  is  like using a wordprocessor--
                    you  can  change  your songs  and  always
                    undo.

                THINK  ALOUD.  ABANDON STUDIOS  is  NOT
                like  other studios. We create for  you
                a   relaxed   environment  where   your
                musical  ideas  can freely  flow.  Easy
                inexpensive  recording  with   powerful
                editing   as   comfortable   as    your
                bedroom.   Here  is  the   studio   you
                requested.
          
          
      $25/hour gets you:
        
      O 8/16 channel digital recording
      O Digidesign non-destructive editing, removable
        Jaz harddisks
      O SMTPE, MIDI, TLC
      O engineers with 10 years recording experience
      O producing and song writing available
      O guitars, sitar, guitar synthesizer, drums,
        acoustic/electronic percussion, turntables, DJ
        mixer
      O additional musicians available (cello, DJ,
        male/female vocals)
      O colorful San Francisco location, easy parking
      O relaxed atmosphere, run by a band not a
        commercial studio
      O yard - goldfish pond - comfy lounge - friendly
        pets
        
      call to arrange a package--
      we negotiate!
      
            We're making our CD here, why don't you?



                                       ABANDON
                                       STUDIOS
                        mailto:hatfyr@slip.net
                                  415.282.7456
        1510 25th St., San Francisco, CA 94107

Subject: Happy and Safe Haloween 
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Everyone from Feel Good E. Wants to wish SFR a Happy Halloween.

The following is a small list of safe party tips for this evening:

If you plan on going to the CASTRO tonight, take public transit.  There
are going to be half a million people out there , and very few parking
spaces.  But it will be worth it.

If you are driving to the FTT Massive, be careful were you park, if it
means walking an extra block, but parking your car in a well lit spot,
or paying for parking... DO IT.   And make sure you cover up or hide
everything in your car... clothing, stereo, tapes, cd's... anything that
would make someone want to break into your vehicle.  If you can, take
BART, and carpool if possible.

Please party responsibly... there will be a lot of people out there
tonight trying to perpetrate on unsuspecting people that are just out to
have a good time...  Be aware.  Not everyone is out there for the same
reasons you are.  Many are out there to capitalize of YOU.  Don't get
taken advantage off and don't get poisoned because some looser wants to
comprimise your health to line their pockets full of cash.

Please practice Safe Sex... Should you be so lucky :)   'nuff said.

Be careful driving tonight because there are going to be enough people
on the road that shouldn't  in any way be driving.  Be aware of them,
And Don't Be ONE of them.

Keep an Eye on your friends, and make sure they are keeping an eye on
you.  Have a meeting spot, and don't overdo it tonight.  Know your
limitations, and don't experiment, tonight is not a good night for that.

Any Ways, Just want to wish everybody a very happy and SAFE Night.  Its
going to be VERY Crazy out there tonight, and just want to remind
everyone to Party Responsibly.

Feel Good E. cares about all you crazy and wondrful ravers out there, so
please pass on this info tonight to others....to show them that you care
as well.

Keep it Real

Vlad aka Ray Vonie

disordr
>
>Everyone from Feel Good E. Wants to wish SFR a Happy Halloween.
>
>The following is a small list of safe party tips for this evening:
>
>If you plan on going to the CASTRO tonight, take public transit.  There
>are going to be half a million people out there , and very few parking
>spaces.  But it will be worth it.
>
>If you are driving to the FTT Massive, be careful were you park, if it
>means walking an extra block, but parking your car in a well lit spot,
>or paying for parking... DO IT.   And make sure you cover up or hide
>everything in your car... clothing, stereo, tapes, cd's... anything 
that
>would make someone want to break into your vehicle.  If you can, take
>BART, and carpool if possible.
>
>Please party responsibly... there will be a lot of people out there
>tonight trying to perpetrate on unsuspecting people that are just out 
to
>have a good time...  Be aware.  Not everyone is out there for the same
>reasons you are.  Many are out there to capitalize of YOU.  Don't get
>taken advantage off and don't get poisoned because some looser wants to
>comprimise your health to line their pockets full of cash.
>
>Please practice Safe Sex... Should you be so lucky :)   'nuff said.
>
>Be careful driving tonight because there are going to be enough people
>on the road that shouldn't  in any way be driving.  Be aware of them,
>And Don't Be ONE of them.
>
>Keep an Eye on your friends, and make sure they are keeping an eye on
>you.  Have a meeting spot, and don't overdo it tonight.  Know your
>limitations, and don't experiment, tonight is not a good night for 
that.
>
>Any Ways, Just want to wish everybody a very happy and SAFE Night.  Its
>going to be VERY Crazy out there tonight, and just want to remind
>everyone to Party Responsibly.
>
>Feel Good E. cares about all you crazy and wondrful ravers out there, 
so
>please pass on this info tonight to others....to show them that you 
care
>as well.
>
>Keep it Real
>
>Vlad aka Ray Vonie
>
>
